Simpson in NAKED GUN I).The only interesting scenes were some pretty good impersonations of Barry Bonds, Tony Bennett, Tom Cruise and Dr. Hawkins.Normally if I don't like a film it's because it most likely is I may not be the target audience of the writers and producers...but the audience consisted of males and females from children to Sr. Citizens.....and I rarely heard anything even remotely close to a chuckle.The banter between husband (Nielson) and Marion Ross was uncomfortable at best...and in a way sad, seeing two people who have had stellar, award winning careers now wandering aimlessly in this poorly thought out and written flop.I recommend not just holding back and wait for it to hit DVD...but even skip the DVD release.Save your money and re-rent Naked Gun or better yet, the Police Squad series for truly spoof mastery.

Well this Film is just full of flat farting jokes.
Its also is not an Superhero parody, its just all about the Spiderman story.
+1Star for having the Legend Leslie Nielsen in it for 2 minutes!

reviews.review_title: I laughed. That's all that mattered to me.
reviews.content: A huge cast of familiar faces and some hysterical special effects guides this spoof of "Spider Man" to becoming a guilty pleasure that had me laughing from the moment our young hero, late for the departing bus for a school trip runs face first into a bus mirror. Okay some of the jokes are tacky and a few in poor taste, but a good majority of them are real knee slappers, especially if you are in a silly mood. Yes, the story is as fresh as last year's daisies, but it moves fast and wi have you pausing to make more popcorn.The style of humor is obvious from the time you see Leslie Nielsen in the credits, playing the uncle of the nerdy hero (a charming Drake Bell) and husband to aunt Marion Ross. The bullied Bell somehow becomes impeccably strong thanks to the sudden bite of a dragon fly and having a mysterious chemical dumped on him. If it isn't animatronic animals lusting over him, it's the ability to completely destroy a scientific exhibit in his school as well as beat up the hated bully and win the love of the class sexpot (Sarah Paxton) who is actually a sweet young girl.Then there's the Green Goblin like villain played by Christopher McDonald with sinister plans which motivates Bell into becoming the super hero. Decent special effects are more funny than impressive, but the pacing of the movie had me engrossed. Cameos by famous character actors are a lot of fun too. Had I been in a bad mood, this quickly would have changed that, and in a good mood, I found myself laughing at the type of visual gags that I would have been crying over when I was a preteen. Now that works for this film viewer in spending 75 minutes that I'll be able to waste again for a second and third viewing, etc.

Following in the wake of other cinematic spoofs of pop culture comes "Superhero Movie", which this viewer would have to guess is at least better than some of them. Mostly a send-up of the Spider-Man origin story, it also takes shots at other iconic superhero characters: the X-Men, the Fantastic Four, etc. Drake Bell plays Rick Riker, a high school loser who is bitten by a genetically enhanced dragonfly while on a class trip. He of course obtains super powers, except the ability to fly. These he will HAVE to put to use when battling the mega-villain The Hourglass (veteran comedy villain Christopher McDonald, appropriately hammy), who must kill people in order to extend his own life.It is refreshing to see writer / director Craig Mazin throw caution to the wind, and refuse to kowtow to political correctness. Point in fact: real-life Dr. Stephen Hawking (played by character actor Robert Joy) comes in for a fair amount of abuse. With the assistance of experienced comedy director David Zucker (one third of that redoubtable team that made "Airplane!"), he actually manages to deliver a respectable amount of genuine laughs. Granted, some of the humour is stupid and obvious, but it still works. Key to "Superhero Movie"s' success is the fact that the actors largely play it straight, as if this was a real superhero movie. We've all known for years that movies of this type aren't nearly as good if it looks like everybody is in on the joke.Many familiar faces abound, although it would be best if this viewer did not spoil them all. Marion Ross of 'Happy Days' fame is appealing as Aunt Lucille (although it's such a shame Mazin & Company resort to a few minutes worth of fart jokes with her character), and spoof legend Leslie Nielsen is in fine form as always as the goofy Uncle Albert. (He and Bell come up with a funny spin on that classic Spider-Man line about great power.)Granted, this is NOT in the same league as "Airplane!" or "Young Frankenstein" (just to throw out two examples of classic, vintage spoofs), but it kills time agreeably enough. There's simply too much outtake and blooper footage during those closing credits, though.Six out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Waaaaaaaaay BAD worse than epic movie don't go see it
reviews.content: just one week after it was out when i went to go see it it was just me and a group of three people that was it and I'm sure that these people must have the humour of five year olds because they laughed at about every time he fell over or hit his head on the bus which you can see on the trailer so although it isn't funny it becomes even less funny after you see it again i would think that the few people that actually go see this movie actually have no brain because it would be torture to watch again i didn't really find anything funny about it i just don't get why miramax wastes their money on drake from drake and josh and the whole cast and the actual money I'm sure if they really though about it they would find that it would be better to give the money they used to make the film to fund say ikea or even a pointless wallpaper shop with no wallpaper in it than waste it on this crap movie

If you have watched any of the genre spoof movies, then you know what to expect. Of course, it helps if you have watched - and enjoyed - the super-hero movies of recent years, especially the first Spider-Man movie, but there is plenty here to entertain as long as you're not particularly highbrow in your tastes.The principals are unknown but acquit themselves adequately, and there are some better-known faces lower down the cast. Marion (Richie Cunningham's mom) Ross is particularly good fun in the Aunt May role played by Rosemary Harris in the Spider-Man movies.There are, broadly, three areas of humour covered: one, outright spoofery of super-hero movies (there is an amusing variation on the creation of Batman incident, for instance), two, simple dumb humour (ie. daft jokes) and, three, flatulence. This film contains the funniest flatulence routine since Blazing Saddles - possibly even funnier. Putting this sequence to one side, all the best gags are in the trailer (apart from a series of ongoing gags at the expense of Stephen Hawking) Conversely, if any of these three areas is likely to upset you, don't see it, because there isn't very much by way of wit, characterisation, plotting etc.Oh, and don't expect a special effects extravaganza, because there are hardly any effects (of the type we've come to expect from super-hero movies) in this movie at all - our hero gets bitten by a genetically engineered dragonfly and develops quick reflexes, some strength, and... er... well, maybe he'll learn to fly some day...

reviews.review_title: An incredibly entertaining and enjoyable comedy!
reviews.content: Superhero Movie is a laugh-a-minute comedy that moves quickly, and has more jokes than you'll know how to handle. I was lucky enough to attend the premier of this movie last night in Los Angeles, and I'd never witnessed a more active and engaged audience. People who had spent months working on it, and were definitely familiar with the jokes, were laughing at the end result, and genuinely enjoying themselves. It's a lot of slap stick and "spoof movie jokes", but you can tell from watching that it took an incredible amount of planning and choreographing in order to get it just right. This movie was great, and you'll definitely get your money's worth if you're looking for a movie that will make you laugh and will keep you giggling each time you see it. PS: Stay throughout all of the credits to see deleted scenes and out-takes! :)

This is the single most stupid of all the direct-parody films that have been coming out over the past 15 years or so. I frequently found myself laughing, not at a joke itself, but at the sheer dumbness of the idea of it. A man sets himself on fire; our hero races in to begin slapping him with a blanket to put out the flames; the man says "get a fire extinguisher!" Hero races in with fire extinguisher and begins slapping the man with it as though it were a blanket. Amusing, but lacks the self-awareness that gave the old Zucker Abrahams Zucker films a sense of total lunacy grounded in love of movies just as such. Which brings us to the weakest part of the film - it looks made for TV - about 15 years ago, before HDTV and widescreen. Worth dumb amusement value if you don't pay much for it, but not the future of comedy in America.

reviews.review_title: The greatest Superhero movie of all time! (not counting all the others)
reviews.content: Rick Riker goes to a field trip and gets bitten by a dragonfly. This soon gives him some powers as a regular superhero, except to fly. Now, he'll use his powers to stop the villain, The Hour Glass, whom takes lives from people by sucking out their remaining years in their lives.Can anyone make a good, or a decent, spoof film? It's apparent that some of the most recent ones are horrible (The Comebacks and Meet the Spartans). This one actually is better than those two, but that's not saying much. Imagine "Meet the Spartans." Now replace all of the pop culture jokes with fart jokes, toiler humor, some slapstick comedy, and physical comedy. This is "Superhero Movie."Is that a good thing? Well, sort of, considering it's not as painful if one joke falls flat, compared to some of the jokes in "Meet the Spartans" and "The Comebacks." But the jokes in here aren't funny either. Now I know people may disagree with me on this but I actually laughed louder from the rare jokes in "Meet the Spartans." However, in "Superhero Movie," I tend to chuckle more. So would you rather laugh, with less jokes or chuckle, with more jokes? I don't know.Calling "Superhero Movie" a spoof is bad. This is not a good spoof film. However, the problem with this movie is that I would've liked the movie more if this had been another superhero comedy, rather than a spoof. Unlike "Meet the Spartans," the plot is a lot better. The characters are lovable. But the jokes are unnecessary.In the end, this is one of the better spoof movies, but that's not saying much. Most of the jokes fall flat and the jokes that are funny, only makes you chuckle. I'm just seriously disappointed by the efforts made by the ZAZ team. They could've done better. Should you watch this? No. If you want to, wait for it to come out on DVD and rent it.

Don't waste your time going to see this movie. I'm a huge fan of Leslie Nielsen and love all of the Airplane and Police Squad movies. This was a sad attempt at trying to use the same type of humor but unfortunately it was just one crude sex joke after another. There were some funny moments, but they were very rare.I'm also an enormous fan of Drake Bell and his TV show that's targeted toward teens. I am completely and utterly disappointed in Drake Bell for his poor performance and complete inappropriateness during most of this movie.This movie was a great idea and the Dragonfly character was a good concept. The special effects were done well. Unfortunately, this movie just simply wasn't funny at all.

reviews.review_title: No physical comedy, no witty dialogue..... meh!
reviews.content: I appreciate spoofs such as "Scary Movie" and "Not Another Teen Movie", but this one was just too corny.It didn't have any physical comedy like Scary Movie (Wayans), nor did it have a smart/funny dialogue like Not Another Teen Movie. The acting was not bad, but they definitely needed physically funny people (Wayans, Jim Carrey, Jack Black...etc). The lead character was OK, but he's definitely not comedy material (especially that kinda comedy).That being said, there were 3 or 4 scenes that were really funny and everyone in the theater was laughing. But that was it! If you still wanna go watch it, go with very low expectations. My problem is that i was expecting something like Scary Movie. I'd give it a 4.9/10

Although I'm not really keen in comedies because most of them are not funny but this one is. It is the same style of the likable Scary Movie franchise. Superhero movie is a spoof of Spiderman, X-men and Fantastic four. If you have nothing to do on a rainy day or something than it's a good movie to watch otherwise it's not watchable anytime because Superhero Movie is not that great. So far the first two Scary Movies did a really good job at spoofing and I can watch them anytime.I think the main problem of Superhero movie is that it tries really hard to be better that the Scary Movie franchise but it didn't and I find it hard not to compare it since its so similar and the Scary Movie franchise is a lot funnier. But it wasn't bad and was quite funny and I probably would've of liked it a lot better if I haven't seen the Scary Movie franchise. If it wasn't too much copy of Spiderman and more of X-men and Fantastic four then that would of help a lot.

reviews.review_title: Not so bad but really hit and miss
reviews.content: I admit I'm a superhero movie aficionado. I even collect them so you would think I would appreciate this kind of spoof or hate it if I lacked a sense of humor. Well, I found Superhero Movie kind of uninspired for such rich source material. It's like a bombardment of jokes, one after the other, but with about only 1 out of 3 finding their target (ratio of hit-to-miss would depend on your personal tastes). It has a fairly strong start but it's like you get exhausted by the barrage (no, not from laughing too much in my case) and the ending in particular is not up to the rest (changed from the originally written one according to the commentary track because of studio directive). You get your fair lot of stupid and silly jokes of the Airplane/Naked Gun type which I don't mind as well as your farting, pissing and puking jokes which were somewhat funny (god, I regressed to 5-year old mental age! :-). There is some amusingly absurd dialog so the movie doesn't rely only on physical humor. The costumes and effects were surprisingly well done for such a low-budget film.It basically follows a similar plot to Spider-man 1 for most of it, with a totally different looking and motivated villain though, adding jokes here and there and contrary to what the poster might have you believe, the other superheroes besides the Dragonfly (the Spider-Man imitation) are reduced to mere cameos which are for the most part lame and unfunny (Professor X does have a little more screen time). It's to the point where the poster is almost like false advertising. The little part spoofing Batman (killing of the parents) was amusing in a dark twisted way. Practically all the jokes referring to modern consumer/internet products (iPod, Google, Youtube, Craigslist, etc) were unfunny and felt more like product placements than anything. There have been many movies in the "..... movie" spoof genre with most of them being considered among the worst movies of all time, certainly the worst-rated ones. Superhero movie is probably near the top of that hall of shame as it's very uneven with some funny moments, not truly downright terrible. In the right mood and with friends, it can be somewhat entertaining. Just rent it though.Rating: 4 out of 10

reviews.review_title: Finally A Spoof That Doesn't Totally Suck
reviews.content: How many superheroes does it take to save the world? The creators of The Naked Gun and Scary Movie answer this question in hysterical "David Zucker" fashion with the uproarious comedy Superhero Movie.Meet Rick Riker. He's young, he's cool and he's got superpowers. Now, if he only knew how to use them... but the world is in danger and no one is safe when Zucker and the gang -- headed by the hilarious cast of Drake Bell, Leslie Nielsen, Tracy Morgan, Pamela Anderson, Regina Hall and many others -- take aim at some of the biggest blockbusters of our time including Spider-Man, Batman, X-Men, and Fantastic Four, to name a few. On March 28th, learning to fly, spinning a web and busting a gut has never been this much fun. Superhero Movie 10/10

reviews.review_title: Very funny but gets old so quickly...
reviews.content: Superhero Movie is another spoof movie that makes you really laugh. It's very dumb, and also very re-mindful of the past "Scary Movie"'s. Maybe because of Regina Hall, maybe because of the writer/director, but it works just as good as them.This film spoofed many internet things that spread not only in the USA, but all over the world. The youtube seek for success, the google domination and the myspace seek for fame are very well spoofed and I remember as it was yesterday when it came out. I saw it in the theaters, these jokes were very appropriated for that time. Unfortunately, many people that get to see this film now won't find it as funny as it was back when released, since they won't understand these jokes very precisely. That's what I mean when I say that "Superhero Movie" gets old so quickly.Moreover, I still have many laughs watching it and it's certainly a good time provider :)

It was a pretty nice movie, didn't except it, it was a parody of a lot of superhero movies such as spider-man and X-man and did it pretty well, it had a lot of "puns" that made it even more amazing, for the people that do get them. It even had casts from the famous parody movies "Scary movie",It even has Kevin Hart in its cast However, i t kinda sucks that this movie has only 4/10 rating, i think that it deserves way more than most of people think. I feel bad that there are movies out there that people give 10/10 ratings because everyone does, and no one even rates this amazing movie, i laughed at least 30 times, more than when i watched "Deadpool" Highly recommended

reviews.review_title: With great success, come great parodies (Screen)
reviews.content: This spoof of « Spiderman » & Co was our second choice (of three) at the free-movies day.If you see the teaser, you have a excellent opinion about the story and the fun. Maybe some scenes are too long or not very funny (especially all involving the bad guy), but I remember we laughed a lot and that's the point. At least a movie without headache! If humor comes from a lot of parodies (the best taking place in "Crime alley" at the exit of a Zorro movie), it also comes from absurd or rude situations, so you don't have to have Ph.D in comics to smile! Leslie Nielsen makes a little participation as "Ben"! A good time with this flick, honestly! A thousand better than the "Spartatouile"!

reviews.review_title: This movie is a horrible nightmare
reviews.content: What can I say, I'm so angry with myself for seeing this movie. I wasn't going to watch it but I gave it a chance just because it was a superheroes theme. Although the film stuck with just one story, it doesn't have no sense between scenes, the parodies are lame, the jokes are very repetitive and aren't funny anymore. The cast is poor and the acting is weak, the only ones that made a barely decent job are Leslie Nielsen and Drake Bell. In conclusion, this movie already has the honor of being the worst movie of the year and I see it impossible that another movie to beat it. It is an hour and a half nightmare. Avoid it at all causes, really its not worthy.Don't waste your time and money. I don't know why the studios still gives money to people to make this crappy film, if they think they can make very good money with them they are so mistaken.

It's a parody comedy and that's how you should treat it. Funny things here in every movie. You definitely won't get bored while watching this movie.The film doesn't last long, it doesn't get boring, on the contrary, you want to watch more. The plot is simple enough - pokes fun at the stupidity of superhero movies of the early 2000s - but this movie doesn't need more than that. Some scenes completely repeat Spider-Man, but with sparkling jokes.The acting is perfect for a movie like this, all the characters are very bright and the jokes are very funny. I especially liked the friend of the protagonist, his uncle, as well as the doctor in the hospital.If you drink with friends or, better, smoke weed, and you wanna watch movie - Superheroe Movie IS for you. Every moment of the film is so LMFAO, I watched it more than 50 times, I remember every line. Also it's very good because of nostalgia to Sam Reimi's Spider Man.Everyone should watch it, and if you don't like it - you have no humor sence.

reviews.review_title: The most I've laughed at a spoof in years.
reviews.content: With the 2 idiots who I won't even bother naming making a stupid spoof movie every year, I thought the spoof genre was done for. Then comes good ol Mr. Zucker (along with the always funny Leslie Nelson) to show that this genre is still alive and well. Now granted, there are some scenes that run on for a little too long, but overall this was a really funny movie. This movie is only REALLY funny if you're a huge fan of the first Spider-Man movie and almost every scene from it is embedded in your memory (man, I couldn't get enough of it lol). This movie spoofs a genre that was WAY overdue for a spoof, and it pulls it off nearly flawless. 9/10

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest spoofs of all time!!!
reviews.content: I have no doubt in my mind. Superhero Movie is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen. Here is what I liked about it: 1. all of the actors did a fantastic job, making jokes funny that would not have been funny otherwise2. All of the jokes were funny, and I mean all of them. 3. The story line was actually not that bad compared to Epic movie, Scary movie, and Meet the Spartans. 4. It surprises you with jokes at the most unexpected timesIf you have any spare time, I recommend seeing this movie. You will not regret it!!

I thought this would be funny. I did. I don't know what happened. But I think a lot of the problem unfortunately falls with the casting. I don't know who this kid is, he could be a very nice person but he wasn't right for this movie. And the supporting cast was great which only makes it more obvious. For example there would be a scene with him and his love interest and your mind just starts to wander off but then Keith David starts speaking, or Leslie Nielsen, or Marion Ross, and it's like someone turned a light on and suddenly you can pay attention again and you think it might not be that bad. But when they get back to the main characters the lights go out again. The spoofing material available in the superhero genre is plentiful so the fact that most of the jokes were basically a fart, makes you wonder who wrote this thing. I mean it had a couple of funny bits, as I do remember laughing a couple of times, but right now I don't remember why and it was only a few days ago.Really I'm giving it a take it or leave it rating but I think most people should just leave it.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as people say
reviews.content: Funny. Hands down, this movie was hilarious. I laughed practically the whole way through. Finally we get a spoof movie where the jokes make sense and are actually funny, some good actors thrown in, and you can walk out feeling like the collosal amount of money you just spent on tickets and snacks was worth it.The main reason this was so good was because the guys who made Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans, and Date Movie were not involved in ANY way. Their spoof movies are literally the sole reasons that I am gradually losing all faith in humanity.Granted Drake Bell was not the best cast for the leading role because of his awkward acting, bad line delivery, and countless others, but the supporting cast was excellent. Leslie Neilsen never lets down, and Christopher McDonald was great as the bad guy. If you are going into this movie expecting an Oscar worthy performance or a movie that may change your outlook on life, then you will be let down. If you are going to this movie just to get out of the house and laugh, then I strongly recommend going to see this. I am a harsh movie critic at times (i.e. I was really not impressed with No Country for Old Men) but this movie is actually a B- rating in my book.

reviews.review_title: Entertaining and funny--but not for the "film snobs" apparently
reviews.content: My knee-jerk reaction prior to seeing this flick was "oh crap, another one of those '(Insert Genre Here)Movie' fiascos," or to put it more succinctly "this is going to REALLY suck." Surprise, surprise, I didn't hate it.The funny thing is that the negative user reviews here seem to come from two types of people: (1.) People who were anxious to bash the next "(Insert Genre Here) Movie." (2.) People whose sphincters are about the size of a pin point and whom have had their senses of humor surgically removed at birth.Kudos to the studio for getting David Zucker in on this. That upped the quality tremendously. Double kudos for keeping Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer unemployed this time. Craig Mazin is a much more competent writer, though if they had brought in Pat Proft, this movie would've been even better. And triple kudos for Leslie Nielsen doing what must be his 150th spoof movie.As for the film itself, it really doesn't belong with "Epic Movie" or "Date Movie." A different title would've brought different preconceptions from the movie-going public. Unlike those movies, it actually doesn't try to stuff 100 movie parodies into a 90 minute film. There aren't as many pop culture references that would make it irrelevant two months after release. And there are some genuine laugh-out-loud moments. (And yes, farts are funny. Any of you stuck-up twits who will herein claim otherwise can take a big whiff of one of mine, because you all know you giggled, even though you pretend to be grossed out.) The movie doesn't reach the nadir of comedy that is "Airplane" or "Naked Gun" (all of which contain fart jokes) but then I suppose it doesn't really try to accomplish that. It's simply a movie that can kill two hours and be enjoyable at the same time, and it's a refreshing riff on the comic book industry as a whole. I can actually see this being a successful comic book, as it reminded me quite often of "The Tick." (Fans of that show will definitely see the similarities.) So all of you "sophisticates" out there can go blow it out your shorts. This movie was never meant for you anyway. (We all know you're not nearly as sophisticated as you'd like us to think anyway.) For the rest of you, enjoy this movie...it's the best step toward classic parody movies that we have had in years.

This film is about a young man becoming an unlikely superhero after being bitten by a genetically modified dragonfly.Surprisingly, "Superhero Movie" is not so bad at all. The plot only briefly draws from the superhero movies. Most of the story is newly written and something we have not seen in the superhero movies. This is what makes it much better than the recent goof "Meet The Spartans".The jokes mainly concentrates on the silliness of the characters, which is a refreshing departure from grossed out jokes in other recent goofs. Rick Riker is a likable character, his silliness is entertaining but not absurdly stupid. The jokes tend to repeat many times over throughout the film, such as having objects hitting the a person's head, or being hit at the balls. "Superhero Movie" is a refreshing departure from the poor goofs we get recently. Though it is silly, it certainly serves the purpose of entertaining people.

This is the first parody film I actually liked a little, since the first Scary Movie. The movie follows Drake Bell from Nickelodeon's Drake & Josh, he plays Rick Riker, a idiot who falls too much. The bad part of this film is the jokes that are overused. Some jokes with Drake are beaten and overused, like the beginning sight gag when he hits the mirror on the bus. That was fine, but he then gets up, gets hit by the stop sign, and then the opening doors. I think they went too far after that. the saving grace for me was the time Leslie Nielsen was in the film, playing the Uncle Ben role. The main spoof of the whole film is Spider-Man, which can be noticed from the first few scenes. Jill Johnson is the spoof Mary-Jane Watson, her character is fine. The main villain in the film is a Green Goblin wannabe who can grab his victims and age them to death. The films sight gags are overused at times, but some of the jokes are fresher than others. This is the second spoof move this year, and this is definitely the better one. It's Superhero Movie and Meet the Spartans. Meet the Spartans sucked, it was terrible. But there is hope for this one. I would say go see it if you like spoof movies from Craig, the director. Or just wait until the DVD.

This movie is about a young teenager who gets bitten by a genetically enhanced insect which gives him super powers...Familiar....Should be..Spiderman..This film has a lot of slap stick humour that is funny but it doesn't work, Drake Bell who is from the hit children's show, Drake and Josh stars as the budding superhero and to be honest, he has no acting talent, he is not funny.The scenes are all from the Spiderman film...which begs me to think that the producers must have been bribed in order to let the director or the concept to be formed....Seriously stay away..
Love everything in it. It never gets old. every time I watch it, its is like a new movie to me

reviews.review_title: To many bad comedies from Hallywood
reviews.content: This is not funny. It is just gross and stupid. How dare there make fun of Stephen Hawking. The story line in this is awful. The hummer is awful. I do not knew why this got a 4.5 is not funny at all. Good actor wasted they talent being in this movie. Do not wast your time. And do not wast your money. This movie stinks. There so many fart jokes that proves that it stinks. The ending is awful. There is nothing wrong with laughing. But how could laugh at this movie. 4.5 is overrating it. This is movie pooh pooh. There is scene with wolverine is taking pooh pooh and proves that it is pooh pooh. This is one of the worst comedies of all time.

reviews.review_title: "Superdud Movie" would be a more appropriate title
reviews.content: It's not fair. I was really expecting this to be a hilarious, entertaining movie. I mean, I like Drake Bell from Drake and Josh, and Leslie Neilson is nothing to be sneezed at since his earliest classics, Airplane and the Naked Gun. However, After seeing Superhero movie, I'm glad I didn't even have to pay for it. It just wouldn't have been anywhere near the 9$ per ticket. More like a dollar and a few pennies. Because that would sum up for the hour and a few minutes. And as disappointing as this film was I'm glad the running time was that short, if not shorter. I just cant believe how incredibly vulgar, unnecessary, and above all, STUPID, some of the scenes were! And above that, I've seen better acting from a wooden dummy(without the ventriloquist). It's as if Craig Mazin purposefully wanted to make a film that deserves its 3.7, if not lower, and even try to be worse than "Meet the Spartans". Very disappointing indeed.

"Superhero Movie" is a remarkable movie...Yes. I did say remarkable. Remarkable for all of the wrong reasons. I had assumed, for good reasons, that the worst movie I would see at the cinema this year would be "Meet The Spartans". How completely wrong that prediction has turned out to be."Superhero Movie" is truly a piece of poo. A terrible, awful, abomination of a movie. I wanted to cry. I wanted to scream. I wanted to pluck out my eyes. I wanted to throw myself off a tall building. I wanted to fight the group of lads sitting a few rows in front of me, because they were laughing at this lamentable piece of rubbish. I wanted to give up going to the movies. I wanted to join a monastery and dedicate my life to basket weaving and caring for lepers.I like stupid, but "Superhero Movie" is just not funny, guy. Basically it is a remake of "Spider-Man" with fart and poo jokes, and the odd nod to other Superhero universes. Cheap and nasty and... Er... poo like.(Da da da daaaaaa!) Hang on! There is a good bit.Pamela Anderson filled the outfit of the Fantastic Four's Invisible Girl a damn sight more spectacularly than Jessica Alba ever did. A shame then that Pammy is only in the movie for about 30 seconds. In fact, much respect to Pammy's costume designer. Pammy's costume was a miracle of industrial engineering. I shudder to think of the gravitational pressures that had to be overcome when that costume was being built. If they had miscalculated, all hell could have broken loose and somebody could have died."Superhero Movie" is a very bad film. See it and weep.

reviews.review_title: The absence of Friedberg and Seltzer is fairly evident, but this is still yet another failure to make a decent spoof movie
reviews.content: If the infamous Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer had anything to do with this spoof of superhero blockbusters from recent years, I would have avoided it like the plague, something I've learned to do with their movies! They made their debut in 1996 as writers of "Spy Hard", a mediocre spy spoof which I've seen twice, but it's still vague in my memory, and instead of improving as they went along, the duo got much worse! I watched "Epic Movie", which is probably the worst excuse for a comedy I've ever seen, then I saw "Scary Movie", the first in the "(Insert Word Here) Movie" series, which they co-wrote with four others, and I didn't find it to be much better. When I heard about "Superhero Movie", knowing Friedberg and Seltzer were not involved, I decided there was still no way I would be seeing it in the theatre, but I would check it out after it came into stores. So, I rented it just yesterday, and while I'm sure it would have been worse with Friedberg and Seltzer's involvement, I'm still not pleased.Rick Riker is an unpopular high school student who witnessed the death of his parents during his childhood and now lives with his Aunt Lucille and Uncle Albert Adams. However, things are about to change when he goes to a laboratory filled with genetically mutated creatures! These creatures include a genetically mutated dragonfly, which comes and bites Riker! After this, it turns out that the bite has given the teenager new superpowers, such as armored skin, super strength, and the ability to cling to walls and ceilings! Because of these new superpowers of his, Riker makes himself a costume and creates himself an alter ego, a local crime fighter known as "Dragonfly"! Unfortunately, things get harder for him when a supervillain named Hourglass starts showing up! He is the alter ego of a scientist named Lou Landers, who is terminally ill and has found a way to survive and become immortal by stealing life forces! As Rick Riker attempts to win the heart of Jill Johnson, the superhero must try to stop his foe before a lot of damage is done!This film is mostly based on 2002's "Spider-Man", and also features elements from other recent superhero movies such as "X-Men" and "Batman Begins". "Superhero Movie" starts out with some poor quality slapstick, with the main character getting hit with several things before getting on the bus. Much more unfunny slapstick follows, such as Professor Xavier explaining how some of his students can go through walls, showing one doing so, and how some others THINK they can go through walls, showing another student crashing into the wall. Another good example of weak slapstick is Rick Riker carrying Jill Johnson unconscious, with her head hitting different things on the table. However, I'm afraid this isn't the only thing that sinks the film! Some things I found to be below average, starting with the first Dr. Stephen Hawking scene (a parody of the real-life, world-renowned scientist and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis victim), where he does a speech, saying how he thinks about suicide every day, and explains the advantages the others in the room have over him in a juvenile manner. Also, unsurprisingly, that's right, this film features some fart jokes. There aren't too many of them, but the most significant one is where Rick Riker and Jill Johnson are sitting in a room, while Aunt Lucille is sleeping on the couch and continuously farting. I can laugh at juvenile humour, if it actually takes some talent to come up with it, but it can go too far, like it does there, same with probably most of the gazillion other times someone has farted in a recent comedy!Since I rented "Epic Movie" last year, Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer have come out with two more projects; "Meet the Spartans", which came earlier this year, and "Disaster Movie", which is in theatres now. Like I said, I've learned to avoid their work like the plague, so I haven't seen either of those movies. Of their four projects from the past couple years ("Date Movie", "Epic Movie", "Meet the Spartans", and "Disaster Movie"), I've only seen the second, but since the rest are generally considered atrocious, just like that one (which I agree with the majority on), I see no point in watching any of them. Also, it was bad enough seeing one of them on the small screen, if I went to see one in the theatre (like I could now with "Disaster Movie"), I'm sure it would be a lot like watching "Epic Movie" again, except this time, I would probably be surrounded by real-life versions of Beavis and Butt-Head! As much as I find Beavis and Butt-Head funny as cartoon characters, the thought of being in a room full of real-life versions of them is pretty scary! As for "Superhero Movie", a movie in the "(Insert Word Here) Movie" series done without the infamous duo, well, unlike "Epic Movie", I actually smiled or snickered here and there, but not usually, so I wouldn't exactly call this one a revolting comedy, but still not worth it. So, I think I'll pass on every future spoof movie entitled, "(Insert Word Here) Movie", however many more may come, and whether Friedberg and Seltzer are involved or not.
This movie da bomb. Funny when granny go farting. I LOL'd when they said goodbye at funorol.
Such a pure comedy with use of several popular superhero movies.

reviews.review_title: A Terminal Case of Trying Too Hard
reviews.content: I'm sitting here wondering why I ticked the "Spoiler" box. I don't get it? What is it? Is it because I seriously want to destroy someone's movie-going experience? Or is it because I feel that this movie warrants serious discussion and the ending is pivotal in said discussion? Well the answer is no. The spoiler is that this movie sucked more than a hooker on two-dollar Tuesdays. If you've seen Spiderman 1, then you've seen this movie. In fact, I think that Spiderman is funnier. And that was a drama.So the whole point of this movie was (apart from screwing me out of AU$9) that Rick Scrubber or whatever his name is, gets bitten by a genetically modified dragonfly. That's directly taken from Spiderman SO IT MUST BE FUNNY RIGHT?! It could have been. Instead, I got a series of shtick that might amuse a nine year old. But alas, I have seen OTHER comedy movies and therefore can see jokes coming.I'm closing this review early, as remembering this makes me nauseous. I feel that these gents have a passion for comedy but don't seem to fully grasp the concept. Comedy is about making people see things differently, sometimes subtly, sometimes not. Its about making people think. Sadly, this film does none of that.

I am a big fan of movies that spoof other movies,celebrities,and pop culture.So what can I say?I looooove this movie?It's done what Scary Movie 4 did:laugh until my sides hurt and couldn't breathe.Give this one a shot.You'll be missing out on a lot if you haven't seen this movie.I've even seen Date movie,Epic movie,Meet the Spartans,and Disaster movie,which also made my sides hurt at some scenes in those movies.So anyway,get off of the couch and watch this movie already.Trust me,You will love it so much you'll feel like watching it again and again and again and again.Sorry for the 4 'agains',I just really love this movie.

reviews.review_title: At Least the Theatre Popcorn was Good
reviews.content: Seriously, that's all I got out of going to see this waste of film, and the popcorn had nothing to do with it-thank goodness! I can see from most of the reviews that I am not alone in this sentiment. This has got to win the award for the absolutely WORST movie in entertainment history! I wish I could have walked out of it, but at today's movie prices you have to get something out of it; besides, it was too windy outside to walk with a full bucket of popcorn! This poor excuse for a film did a TERRIBLE job of movie parodies, and it was so full of nothing but crude jokes and sexual innuendo that even the teenagers in the audience were making fun of it after the first 15 minutes! All the filthiness overshadowed the plot so much that I forgot what the movie was supposed to be about! It had nothing but raunchy exhibitionism that you would expect to see on You Tube, not on the big screen!It was embarrassing to see such great actors like Marion Ross, Brent Spiner and Lesle Neilsen try to make this film amusing. If this was to be Drake Bell's debut in a lead movie role, I would suggest that he erase this one off his resume! He had so much potential, but all I can see from this experience is that he knows how to use profanity! I have more respect for Josh Peck now! I could sling a lot more hash regarding this trash, but I think I've made my point clear enough! DO NOT waste a ticket on this movie, DO NOT even rent it on video and DO NOT waste your time watching it on regular TV, unless you enjoy watching nothing but one hour and 85 minutes of CRUD!

reviews.review_title: Not your average crappy spoof movie
reviews.content: Finally, not such a horrible spoof. After Epic Movie, Date Movie & Scary Movie 3,4 I could not tolerate another stupid spoof movie. Not to mention not even seeing Meet The Spartans.The main plot is spoofing Spiderman with Drake Bell leading as the teen who gets bitten by a dragonfly and receiving powers. Of course, he secretly loves his hot neighbor and fights the evil doctor.My main two flaws with this movie was how they tried to hard to get a punchline. They tried a punchline every 30 seconds, when maybe 4/10 worked. Also, the Regina King character was so pointless and dumb to me. She was so annoying with her yelling "you cheatin' on me", just ugh.Superhero Movie is okay for a rental, but nothing that special.

reviews.review_title: A decent attempt in a now reviled genre
reviews.content: I'm going to be saying some of negatives and gripes I had with the movie, but just remember I still gave this a 6 because it was funny at times.I'm a big fan of flatulent comedy when done right. Blazing Saddles did it beautifully (and was the first movie ever to have an on screen fart). Superhero movie seems to very single-minded on this aspect: old people = farts. One of the fart scenes was a little funny at first, but then goes on way too long.This movie is called Superhero Movie yet is devoid of spoofs from most of them. It only spoofs three movies: mainly Spider-man, a little X-men, and a tiny bit of Batman Begins. Sadly, here the writer fell into the same mindset of Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer who have almost destroyed the spoof genre with their atrocities Date Movie, Epic Movie, and Meet the Spartans. What made spoofs of old so good was when they spoofed a genre they didn't just look at the new hot commodities, they looked at all the films in that genre across the years. A more recent spoof who did it well was Not Another Teen Movie. It not only spoofed the new aged Freddy Prince Jr teen romance movies, but also went back to the John Hughes films of the 80's. I think this spoof would be more accessible to people outside of high school had he threw in some spoofs of the old Batman or Superman movies. Maybe even a little bit of a throwback to the Adam West Batman or Lou Ferrigno Hulk TV shows.My last gripe is about the main actor Drake Bell. He might work for little kids on Nickelodeon, but he doesn't for this movie. For the sake of brevity I'll just say that if you see this movie you'll know what I'm talking about.Those were some serious gripes, but it doesn't mean I didn't laugh. One scene in particular had me in stitches. The scene spoofed the Spider-man scene where Parker is late for dinner and is hiding from a searching Osborn on the ceiling of his room. I couldn't stop myself from laughing. I thought the scene was brilliant. Though some jokes do fall flat it is bound to happen when you spring a new joke every 15 to 30 seconds.

I took my 14 year old to see this movie. We left after 15 or 20 minutes. It was absolutely awful! This movie should be rated R at the least. I am not that strict with movies but, this was just too much. It was a waste of money. I thought it would contain some comedy and I knew the comedy would probably be crude but, this was WAY beyond crude. I was sitting there watching and reading (a certain subtitle at the beginning of the movie was what really got me) and I could not believe how crudely sexual it was. I could not believe that it would be OK for a 13 year old to read and see this content. I don't understand how the rating system works.??

reviews.review_title: better than most of the recent bad spoofs
reviews.content: This one is spoofing a lot on the Spiderman franchise as well plenty from every other superhero movie. Rick Riker (Drake Bell) is the geeky student. He is infatuated with fellow student Jill Johnson (Sara Paxton). Trey (Kevin Hart) is his best friend. They go to Lou Landers (Christopher McDonald)'s labs on a school excursion. There he is bitten by a mutant dragonfly. He lives with his uncle Albert (Leslie Nielsen) and aunt Lucille (Marion Ross) since he lost his parents.There are a lot of bad spoof movies these days. This one is the best of a bad lot. At least it's actually following a functional superhero movie story. And the best thing may be that it has Leslie Nielsen. Nobody can tell a deadpan joke quite like him. He still hits it out of the park time and time again. Drake Bell is not necessarily a good actor and the movie suffers because of him. It comes close but it's not good enough to recommend. The classics are still unsurpassed.

reviews.review_title: A Super-zero movie to slap you down with vengeful yawns
reviews.content: Written and directed by Craig Mazin this is a spoof movie much like Scary Movie, Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans, etc. The film follows the Spiderman tried and tested formula. As an audience we follow Rick Ryker who has been left an orphan to be raised by his aunt and uncle. On a school field trip he is bitten by a mutated dragonfly which bestows on him great powers. As you know by now, with great powers comes great yada yada blah blah. Rick becomes a superhero and tries to save the day from Lou Landers, a.k.a. Hourglass, his evil nemesis while desperately trying to win the affection of his attractive neighbour. Despite having David Zucker and Lesley Nielson attached to this film it was nowhere near the league of the "Airplane!" or "Naked Gun" movies which was a sad shame. More dumb than fun this film tries to use slapstick and witty humour throughout but falls short by a long way, in fact a lot of the film is very predictable and there for slightly boring too. There are a lot of cultural references and nods to other superhero films but not in a clever way at all so it makes the film feel like it's a desperate sibling nagging for attention just to justify it. If you haven't guessed by now I didn't really enjoy this; I can deal with the crass fart jokes and I can deal with the whiny stereotypical characters throughout. What upset me the most was the wasted opportunity. With so many superhero movies out there now this film could have been soo much more but as a satirical poke at them it falls flat on its toothless face. Sorry, I can only give this 3 out of 10 because I'd have been happy to turn it off or fall asleep instead. I can't say I'd recommend this, and I definitely won't be rushing to watch this again.

They just don't make comedies like this these days, as everything nowadays have to be political or socially correct, and writers seems to be walking on eggshells, afraid of their material is offensive to even a single person out there in the world.The 2008 spoof comedy titled "Superhero Movie" is fun to watch and definitely is a movie that appeals to my sense of humor. Then again, I've always enjoyed these kind of spoof comedies, which sadly don't get made anymore.The storyline in "Superhero Movie" is very reminiscent of the "Spiderman" story. Yet, writer and director Craig Mazin does manage to cram in a lot of comedy and good laughs throughout the course of the movie. Lots of good jokes with puns, slapstick comedy and just good spoofing of other superhero movies."Superhero Movie" has a great cast ensemble, with the likes of Leslie Nielsen, Christopher McDonald, Kevin Hart, Keith David, Brent Spiner, Robert Joy, Jeffrey Tambor, Robert Hays, Tracy Morgan and Regina Hall. So there is an abundance of familiar faces to be seen in the movie.I enjoy "Superhero Movie" and having just sat down to watch it again for the third time here in 2021, since it was originally released back in 2008.My rating of "Superhero Movie" lands on a six out of ten stars.

With all the recent successful adaptations of famous superheroes, from Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, etc, it was inevitable the makers of Scary Movie, and The Naked Gun, would attempt this spoof movie. The story follows the Spider-Man plot, with a couple of bits from Batman Begins, X-Men and Fantastic Four thrown in. So teenager Rick Riker (Drake & Josh's Drake Bell) gets bitten by a dragonfly, which is what he becomes, he is an orphan living with Uncle Albert (Leslie Nielsen) and Aunt Lucille Adams (Marion Ross), he is in love with Jill Johnson (Sara Paxton) but can't say it, Lou Landers (Christopher McDonald) has turned himself into energy sucking enemy The Hourglass, and Rick, or Dragonfly, is saving the day. Also starring Independence Day's Brent Spiner as Dr. Strom, Scary Movie 3 and 4's Kevin Hart as Trey, 30 Rock's Tracy Morgan as Dr. Xavier, a very brief appearance by Pamela Anderson as The Invisible Girl, Miles Fisher as Tom Cruise, Ryan Hansen as Lance Landers, Keith David as The Chief of Police, Robert Joy as Stephen Hawking, Jeffrey Tambor as Dr. Whitby, Airplane!'s Robert Hays as Blaine Riker, Scary Movie's Regina Hall as Mrs. Xavier, Scary Movie 4's Craig Bierko as Wolverine, Scary Movie 3's Simon Rex as The Human Torch and The Simpsons' Dan Castellanetta as Carlson. The fart gags are always a giggle, the many faces, and the recognisable references, even a mistake made in Spider-Man, i.e. that hand on face bit, all complete a film, much better than previous attempts by the same makers, e.g. Date Movie, Meet the Spartans. Worth watching!

reviews.review_title: An unfairly treated funny superhero spoof
reviews.content: Based on IMDb rating and on critics and reviews everywhere, I expected a horrible film, just one more of those awful spoof movies Hollywood produces dozens each year. Well, since its beginning, though, it showed that it would be quite a great surprise. It is campy and silly, off course, and that is not a problem as it is a well made comedy that knows what it does. It is a dark humor parody of famous superhero films and stories such as Batman, Spiderman, X-Men, and Fantastic Four. Most of the jokes are nice (how to say that a film with a "Tom Cruise" sketch like that is bad?!) and I could not avoid but to laugh a lot. Critics are unfair; much worse films (including "serious" superhero acclaimed pyrotechnical crap) receive more favorable opinions, what is hard to understand.

I think that the Zucker brothers, like many other comic directors, had the bar of what's funny pass them up a long time ago.This movies spoofs Superhero movies, basically taking the plot from Spiderman and doing a bunch of obligatory gags about flatulence, body functions, and so on. Most of them don't work because they were done when the movies they spoofed were still fresh. For instance, Jack Black did a skit on the MTV Awards where he parodied the costume design scene and nipples in the rain from Spiderman, and they WERE funny. This movie did both and they weren't.Also, they take something that might be mildly amusing, and beat it to death. (The flatulence joke with Dragonfly's Aunt is a good example. Flatulence was comical in Blazing Saddles because nobody dared do it before. This was just over the top and redundant.) We also have riffs on Batman, X-Men and Fantastic Four here, but none of them are very comical, either.

reviews.review_title: One of the few recent parody films that works
reviews.content: Okay, yes this is another send up film (ala Meet the Spartans, Disaster Movie, Date Movie and every other film of that ilk) that uses the Spiderman movies as a line to hang it all on.Better than most of the films of this sort it suffers in that that it actually has a more plot than jokes. One would think that would be a good thing, except that the plot is good enough to almost want them to play it straight, even though you're dying for a few big belly laughs. But thats the rub, this film is amusing but not as laugh out loud funny as most of the similar films some times are (hey even the turkeys had some out loud laughs-this is chuckles). Still on its own terms this is worth actually sitting down and watching as opposed to any of the similar films where its best to use your remote to scan to the next good bit.5 out of 10

reviews.review_title: Better than the recent spoof movies
reviews.content: After the disappointing spoof movies that has been made recently I thought the spoof movie genre was finished, they had done that many it was hard to make them funny anymore. When I went to see Superhero Movie I had low expectations for it, Meet the Spartans was released this year and that wasn't a great hit so I felt Superhero Movie was going to be the same. But while watching it I actually found it entertaining, it was defiantly an improvement compared to the recent spoof movies. Superhero Movie does have it's problems such has the wooden acting from some of the cast and some of the jokes are kind of silly and drag on. The farting scene was funny at first but they kept dragging it until it wasn't funny anymore, that aside Superhero Movie did have some great jokes and some funny scenes. Lesie Nelson still does a great job, he's a master at these kind of comedies.Superhero Movie may not be for everyone's taste but for those that love these spoof movies, they should definitely check it out. People that have been put off by the past spoof movies like Date Movie and Epic Movie may want to give this movie a chance, it's no masterpiece but it is a improvement.

reviews.review_title: Zucker produces his best spoof in 14 years!!!
reviews.content: I went to the cinema to see "Superhero Movie" this evening, i was expecting a Scary Movie 3/Scary Movie 4 sort of standard but i was surprised, it was even better than them, and that's saying something!!!This is my favourite spoof since i saw the amazing (and a favourite) Naked Gun 33 1/3 a while ago, sure there were no Hollywood A-Listers like Tom Cruise (although he is spoofed in this movie, and spoofed well) but there's still my all time favourite actor Leslie Nielsen, and once again he delivers the same hilarious jokes he is known for!If you want to know the plot, it's basically the same as Spiderman, only with a funny twist.I'm disappointed that it has only made $47,000,000 worldwide so far, it's a great film and it's sad that it's not being recognised by the public, now the chances of a sequel are very low :(Anyway, those guys who didn't go see it are missing out and it's their own fault, they don't know what there missing.Not many spoofs coming out that interest me for a good while, well "Disaster Movie" is coming out in late August so it should be fun and i guess that's it for spoofs until "Scary Movie 5" comes out in late 2009, ah well.9/10

reviews.review_title: Can anyone be a superhero these days
reviews.content: When I first saw the trailer for this film I didn't have high hopes for it. One, it seemed to follow the pattern of scary movie and their abrasive form of humor. Two, the superhero was Drake bell and seeing as I have watched his television series from time to time, I didn;t think I could take him seriously. The story reveals a character, who is awkward, and comes to his powers by a genetically mutated dragonfly. As he goes though discovering his powers, he clumsily gets into accidents and saves people, but only to be the one to hurt them in the first place. It is a strange form of parody of spider man, instead of Tobey McGuire, it is drake bell and instead of Kirsten dunst it is Sara Paxton. I guess I can;t rate this movie any higher, because I am not into the potty humor (I wasn't a big fan of the scary movies either). I can say that I had some optimism for this movie before I watched it, but while I was watching it that optimism was not really clear any more. I say that if you like scary movies or family guy than this may be the movie for you, but for the people who find crude humor to get old fast, I advise you to see something else.

I really don't what is these guys are doing wrong but they are doing it soooo wrong.Scary Movie was hilarious, Scary Movie 2 was funny and Scary Movie 3 was OK but ever since film makers have been trying to make the same movie from the same formula but failing miserably. You only need to look at the last attempt, Meet The Spartans which was beyond terrible.Superhero Movie is much the same as the others but other than the one scene where Granny cant stop farting there really wasn't anything remotely funny! Even the characters weren't funny or remotely appealing and yet oddly enough, the only cameo which had any thing going for it was by Pamela Anderson and that really says it all. Its one of those movies where the only funny parts are the parts shown in the trailer! So it starts off as a mickey take from Spiderman, giving us Dragonfly which starts off as possibly a good line to take but then we get X-Men, Iron Man and God knows what else.What has happened to comedy recently? This isn't comedy, its not close to being Scary Movie and its only saving grace is that its not as bad as Meet The Spartans.Please, please, please stop making this dribble.

reviews.review_title: The best "movie" parody but not amazing
reviews.content: It's the best parody movie out of the movie bunch, but that doesn't mean it's amazing. It is really funny at most parts, but can get kinda boring at few. Also I admit, it appeals to a pretty specific audience, male teenagers, but it still can be enjoyed by others.

Superhero Movie (2008): Dir: Craig Mazin / Cast: Drake Bell, Sara Paxton, Christopher McDonald, Leslie Nielsen, Kevin Hart: Imaginative spoof of superhero movies. Drake Bell is bitten by a dragonfly thus infecting him with strange powers. Formula storyline has him using his powers against criminals while donning a green costume. Great setup with a knockout conclusion directed by Craig Mazin. Bell is perfectly cast as a nobody who suddenly becomes a somebody and doesn't know what to make of it. Supporting roles are not so fortunate. Sara Paxton's function here is to look good. She is the standard love interest in the tradition of Mary-Jane in Spider-Man but lacking any form of character. Christopher McDonald plays a lifeless villain Hourglass whose final scene has his face in the most embarrassing place any villain could end up. Perhaps the issue is that he travels the same ground as the villain in Spider-Man but becomes a joke as oppose to exploiting them. Leslie Nielsen plays Bell's uncle who doesn't quite die. He is the one supporting role that contains any interest and he side steps every predictable moment played out by Peter Parker's uncle in Spider-Man. Kevin Hart plays the flat best friend whose one funny scene has him assaulted with a nail gun. Although far from the best movie parody the superhero jokes work well in this colourful spectacle. Score: 6 / 10

Really bad. barely funny. laughed a few times but most of the jokes failed. hard. and so many parts went on for way too long. after chuckling i would say "ok now they killed it" and they would do it 4 more times lol. so much terrible slapstick garbage. poorly made on so many levels.And the movie was only an hour and 8 minutes long excluding credits. I think that's shorter than the minimum, which is why i'm guessing they added a bunch of deleted scenes during the credits. that was not a mistake. i don't mean gag reels, i mean deleted scenes that were removed from various parts of the movie. i've never seen anything like it. (1 viewing)

reviews.review_title: This review mainly applies to the humor of the movie and -not- to the plot...
reviews.content: I've got to say that despite what most people reviewed this movie as i found it very entertaining although i can definitely see why this would get low ratings for cheap humor (not that i totally disagree with that) but still despite the cheap humor me and my friend found ourselves laughing very hard at the jokes. If someone asked me to compare this to another comedy i'd compare it to airplane, anyone who has seen airplane can understand this review, its basically very random jokes that are funny but had nothing to do with each other, which brings me to reviewing the plot which without the humor gets like -1 stars but still i give this movie such a high rating mainly because of the way it caused me and my friend to laugh really hard.

reviews.review_title: Wasn't great, but it wasn't bad either.
reviews.content: Here is another spoof movie, filmed within the time period as the disastrous Epic Movie and Meet the Spartans. However, it turned out to be pretty funny and entertaining and certainly not as atrocious as Epic Movie and Meet the Spartans. Here, Drake Bell plays orphaned high school student Rick Riker, who is bitten by a radioactive dragonfly, turning him into a super-powered human (paradying, of course, Spiderman).There is a good deal of sexual humor and crude jokes that gets old throughout the plot, but they are counterbalanced by a funny dose of witty and classic comedy courtesy of veteran actors Robert Hays and Leslie Nielson of Airplane! There are hilarious scenes one after the other that I've found to be quite riveting. One of my favorite parodies is Sara Paxton as Jill Johnson's spot-on Kirsten Dunst impression.This movie is produced by one of the Zucker brothers and he brought some of his earlier spoof movies-styled humor with him for this film, but the movie just falls short in quality and overall entertainment compared to those earlier films. Again, it's not a bad film, you'll still get a few laughs, but don't expect it to be Airplane!, Naked Gun or Scary Movie funny.Grade C+

reviews.review_title: It's pretty bad but not terrible
reviews.content: *Disclaimer: the only reason I watched the film was for Leslie Nielsen. The man is a comedy God and is automatically funny in anything he is in.Superhero Movie, while by no means the worst spoof movie ever made, is still pretty dreadful. It relies far too much on cheap slapstick humour and fart jokes which is a shame as the actual spoof part of the movie had a lot of potential to it, particularly the ending which even managed to achieve some interesting plot elements. There were even a few moments that reminded me of the comedy gold that was Airplane! and the Naked Gun series (although that could have been because the gags were lifted straight from them). In the end though I was more bored than entertained and felt the film dragged on for too long (despite the short runtime of only 70min).I was surprised to see quite a few familiar faces pop up in the movie (Jeffrey Tambor and Kurt Fuller to name a few) and they did a good job of providing some much needed laughs. The main highlight however, as mentioned above, was the comedy wonder-gem that is Mr Nielsen. Don't get me wrong, the material he's given is terrible, but his delivery is so perfect that it gave me an excuse to keep watching. In fact, I would argue that his inclusion alone makes it a film worth watching. I should also mention that Christopher McDonald also plays his part well and is actually a pretty good counter-part to Willem Dafoe's Norman Osborne character from Spiderman.In the end however you are left with a film that has a few chuckles here and there but mostly groans of despair throughout. Stay for Uncle Albert but otherwise seek your laughs elsewhere.

Here's a spoof that's guaranteed to entertain folks in the IQ range of Homer Simpson. It's a cheap shot at every great Superhero, notably Spiderman and Batman. But it doesn't end there; it gets progressively worse until it disintegrates into a pathetic ensemble of slapstick trollop by the truckload.For those interested in the plot, you've only to watch Spiderman while under the influence of some heavy narcotic. What you get is Dragonfly Man  a boy wonder, who loves the girl next door, suddenly inheriting some stupendous super-powers.The rest of the script is as predictable as waking up in the morning and brushing your teeth, but don't' take my word for it! For kids, this is somewhat amusing; for adults it's a great film to drop the kids off for.

The "movie-genre parody" is often the option of last resort for Hollywood screenwriters who've run out of inspiration. Having already skewered such popular genres as the disaster movie, the sword-and-sandal epic, romantic comedies, horror films, spy thrillers, crime dramas etc., they now take aim at the "superhero movie," with a flick ingeniously entitled - yea, you guessed it - "Superhero Movie."In a time span of eighty-minutes that feels more like eight hundred, "Superhero Movie" lumbers from one unfunny joke and sight gag to another, barely taking time out for such apparently dispensable elements as originality or wit. However, in all fairness, one should at least note that writer/director Craig Mazin saves most of his best material - such as it is - for the last half hour.Drake Bell is the Peter Parker to Sara Paxton's Mary Jane Watson in what is essentially a flatfooted parody of the "Spiderman" franchise, with the nerdy high school student in this case being bitten by a genetically-engineered dragonfly, turning him into the crime-fighting figure known as - what else? - The Dragonfly. The movie also makes the occasional obligatory nod to other comic book adaptations such as "Iron Man," "X-Men" and "Batman Begins," but, since it was released before "The Dark Knight," there is no reference to that landmark work - or to its iconic Joker character - in this film, a real lost opportunity.We've indeed come a long way from the glory days of "Airplane" (a fact further emphasized by the presence here of David Zucker as co-producer and Leslie Nielson as one of the movie's co-stars), but "Superhero Movie" is substandard even by "Epic Movie/Date Movie" standards.

Really - I'd take this movie over any of the serious superhero films. Why? Because I'd rather laugh at them in a spoof than critique everything wrong with the serious ones.This film will appeal to "stupid-funny movie" lovers. If you can't handle the ridiculousness of "stupid-funny movies" then don't watch because it will only annoy you. For those like me who love stupid-funny movies (Airplane, Naked Gun, Billy Madison) - don't pass on this thinking that it's as bad as Date Movie, Epic Movie, or Meet the Spartans because those failed since they just weren't very funny. Those are examples of "stupid-trying to be funny but-unfunny movies."Superhero Movie takes a jab at the comic-book-hero-to-movie genre. It basically uses the Spider-man 1 script and tosses in references from X-Men, Fantastic Four and Batman Begins. The dinner table scene, where our hero is trading injury discoveries with the villain, is a high point. Leslie Nielsen deadpans his jokes in his usual style as Uncle Albert and Tracy Morgan is a silly Professor X. There are obvious product placements throughout but they're done in a humorous way.Don't miss the outtakes during the end credits, they're every bit as funny as the movie itself. Especially the Tom Cruise impersonator who is excitedly berating his interviewer. "Just Stop. Stop. Shut...up!" I also liked the catchy Superhero song "we're almost outta time" which plays during the credit rolls.

This movie will challenge you to sit through ten minutes of it--it's that bad. Being a low-rent "spoof," one can expect stupid sight gags, potty humor, etc. But this pile of fertilizer is even worse than expected.Leslie Nielsen has made some funny satire movies, but this time he plasters on a shocked, dimwitted stare for the whole running time. It's actually embarrassing, and nobody else seems to care what they look like, either. The whole "dressing up in ballet tights" routine to ridicule comic book heroes has been done before, and it never was very funny. In this slop, it's just tiresome. And dull. Does anybody think pushing a Stephen Hawking look-alike off a high rise building is funny? Then get ready for a barrel of laughs; that example pretty much describes the level of thought and creativity put into this thing.Can comedy be measured with negative numbers? If so, this movie achieves that.
It's just parody, calm down guys. Yeah, it's not funny, maybe in one scene(maximum). But maybe the main goal of this parody is to show how to create bad superhero movie not funny parody, not sure.

This movie was funnier than I expected. It had quite a few jokes that worked for me. It's a spoof based mainly on the Spiderman films and a little bit of X-men and Batman thrown in. Leslie Nielsen had some funny scenes as the grandfather. Then there is the friend, Trey, whom is obsessed with ipods and computers. They make fun of the kiss scene in Spiderman. There's also the funny boss at the newspaper. There's just too many funny scenes to name. About the only joke that I thought went to far and was offensive was Stephen Hawking. The writers should not have gone there.FINAL VERDICT: A silly comedy that works; worth a viewing.

Superhero Movie is one of those spoof movies that seem to come out every year. After the big disappointment of Meet the Spartans, I didn't expect much out of this. I was pleasantly surprised. This is a good spoof movie but of course all the Scary Movies were better. I don't think any spoof could beat those.The main plot has the story of Spiderman. But other elements have been added such as Airplane and Naked Gun. If you seen Spiderman, you should know what to expect from the plot.There are some pretty big names here with the biggest being the late Leslie Nielsen. He is the master of comedy and spoofs. I think Drake Bell did a decent job but I liked him more on his TV show, Drake and Josh.Overall, this is a good, ordinary spoof movie. There is nothing new here. Just the same good old crude jokes. I rate this film 7/10.

I know parody movies don't get high ratings , but this one is one of the funniest movies I've ever seen ..! It you will make you laugh a lot , just forget its a parody. And you're going to spend an amazing 2hrs

Before watching Superhero movie, i was thinking that it was gonna be bad like the other spoof movies (epic movie, disaster movie, meet the spartans) but this one was actually surprisingly pretty good. Superhero movie is full of some of the most spontaneous and genuine humour that we've seen recently from the filmmakers, and is somewhat of a return to form. There are some laughable jokes in there and some funny humour. Though, the acting is kind of shaky and sub-par.And on that point, it's annoying that their other movies have been so awful. But having said that, the movies they send up are perfect, Spiderman, X-Men, and Fantastic Four had it coming frankly. When this film is on a roll, very few others can top it. This movie actually has a decent plot, its not just some random crap like the others. Its still not that great but its an improvement. They still include some cheesy stuff but thats not that bad I like the last scene when the hourglass pushes Jill out the window then Rick goes and saves her, then he realizes that he can fly, that was a nice ending. Jill realizes that the Dragonfly is really Rick because she sees Ricks ring.As a rewatch 10/08/22' opinions remain same if not slightly better. After having rewatched other "movie" spoofs (Epic movie, Disaster movie), it is very clear Superhero movie is a much better film and it does better justice as a parody. For one, it doesn't cram nonsense jokes quickly for the sake of it. The jokes are silly and juvenile but quite clever and funny. The Tom Cruise impersonator was pretty funny. Had forgotten about Tracy Morgan's professor Xavier role. That was also quite funny. Also the film doesn't drag on, it is quite short and gets straight to the point. Nothing feels too forced. Rating changes from 6 to 7. Quite an underrated film of anything.

reviews.review_title: DC and Marvel Heroes fans hate this movie
reviews.content: Don't let the rate fool you, this movie was intended to be funny and it was superfunny.

reviews.review_title: One of the better spoofs of the 2000s, but still not good
reviews.content: Rick Riker (Drake Bell) is a geeky teenager, orphaned at a young age and now living with aunt Lucille (Marion Ross) and uncle Albert (Leslie Nielsen), who's the object of abuse for pretty much everyone including his best friend Trey (Kevin Hart). Rick has a crush on "girl next door" Jill Johnson (Sara Paxton), who unfortunately for Rick is dating his bully Lance (Ryan Hansen). Following an incident where Rick is bitten by a genetically altered dragon fly giving him the ability to stick to walls as well as reinforced skin, which allows him to become the superhero, the Dragonfly. When an evil business magnate, Lou Landers (Christopher McDonald) uses an experimental formula on himself to cure a terminal illness, the treatment works and gives him the ability to drain the lifeforce of people and extending his life one day for every life taken. Lou becomes the supervillain The Hourglass and when he plans to achieve immortality only Rick can stop him.One of a number of parody films released through the 2000s and trying to capture the success of Scary Movie, Superhero Movie began life as Superhero! With Airplane! And Naked Gun director David Zucker initially slated to direct. After Superhero! Was delayed, David Zucker instead directed conservative comedy, An American Carol, and stepped back into a producing role with the reins handed to Craig Mazin who wrote Scary Movie 3 and 4. Mazin is no stranger to superhero comedies having directed the 2000 comedy, The Specials from writer James Gunn. Superhero Movie is of higher quality than most of the spoof films of its time such as Date Movie, Epic Movie, and Meet the Spartans, but make no mistake just because it's "better" doesn't make it "good".Superhero Movie came out at a strange era of the Superhero genre where superhero films had recovered from the stink of flops like Batman & Robin or Steel (Halle Berry's Catwoman film notwithstanding) but they still weren't treated with all that much respect. While films like the X-Men series or Christopher Nolan's Batman Begins tried to approach the material respectfully, it was Sam Raimi's Spider-Man being a box office juggernaut that inspired the direction of films of the era such as Daredevil, Tim Story's Fantastic Four films, or Ghost Rider where the camp was played up. Superhero Movie is primarily a parody of the first Sam Raimi's Spider-Man films with ancillary references to X-Men, Fantastic Four, and Batman Begins sprinkled throughout. While there's a lot of goofiness in the Raimi Spider-Man films that's been mocked both upon release and in hindsight, the Raimi films were usually faithful recreations of Silver Age comic book stories so they were aware of their goofiness and played it up. This is where Superhero Movie stumbles as Drake Bell's take on Rick Riker is pretty much the same as Peter Parker only with exaggerated self-awareness of the situation making the character less funny than Tobey Maguire's take on the parody target by comparison. Peter Parker was such an exaggerated geek stereotype in the Raimi films that it's not really possible to parody him so the movie just makes him aggressively dumb and accident prone similar to protagonists in the Scary Movie films.The movie also features tangents wherein Rick Riker encounters other superheros like parody's of the X-Men at the Academy for Gifted Non-Asians or Johnny Storm whose flame powers in the movie put him in unbearable pain and like the Peter Parker parody the actual X-Men films and even Chris Evans in Fantastic Four were funnier and more engaging than their parodies here. The movie also features a lot of the contemporary references these movies became infamous for with references to things like Tom Cruise's interview where he called psychology "psuedoscience", Britney Spears' bizarre behavior, Barry Bonds' steroid abuse allegations, and references to T-Mobile's "Fave Five" which I'd wager nobody remembered after about a year. South Park had already run most of these topics into the ground about 3 years before this movie was even made so it just comes off as desperate and pandering. The one element that I'd say works is Christopher McDonald as our villain Lou Landers/The Hourglass, McDonald gets the best jokes in the film (particularly a sight gag involving a portrait of himself that's very funny) and he really taps into the essence of Willem Dafoe's performance as Green Goblin in a way where McDonald wouldn't be out of place playing a straight supervillain in an actual comic book movie while still engaging in silliness that makes it funny.Superhero Movie is marginally better than the majority of parody/spoof films from the mid-2000s, but it's still not at an acceptable level. While the movie stays on target most of the time and has some funny jokes in it, it's hampered by the hackneyed style popularized by the first Scary Movie that's been regurgitated to diminishing returns over the course of a decade.

This movie was definitely a major standout in the recent pile of crappy "spoof" movies that have been made more recently (Epic Movie, Date Movie etc.). I was expecting it to be better than these anyway, but it was still better than I expected.I think the main plus about this was its format. They finally went back to what worked in the first couple of Scary Movies - they followed a plot from a single movie and just made fun of it. There were a couple of side notes but they still linked in quite well to the overall plot.
