Even with a couple of try-hard comedic moments, the story flowed well and it wasn't a clumsy mish-mash of anything and everything to do with superhero movies. I was laughing most of the way through.I'd recommend it to anyone who liked the first couple of Scary Movies.

reviews.review_title: The Jokes were taken too far and the movie wasn't taken far enough
reviews.content: first of all if you think of not going to see this film because it is part of the "(place movie genre here) movie" series that follows after Epic Movie think again. this movie has nowhere near the amount of crap that made epic movie into a descent fertilizer but does follow one little error that all comedies are making nowadays. the jokes go on to long. the punch line hits you and then proceeds to repeatedly kick you while your down. but it does not mean it;s not funny, they simply didn't have the effect. now as far as plot goes it perfectly rips off spider man, and only spiderman. these movies always have had some sort of combination of all the film plots but this only follows spiderman. I thought that they would tackle most of the hit films in this flick, but I was sadly let down. most of the other hero appearances serve as a cameo and they don't really give anyone a line of dialog in the whole movie. what I was really waiting to see was the big superhero team up and way over done final fight sequence like in Spiderman 3. ( a movie which is actually worse than this one ) when the movie ended I felt unsatisfied of what i saw. there is no real build in the movie even though these types of movie don't really need one there is absolutely none what-so-ever. there were a few scenes that I was really waiting to see out of this movie. mostly the superhero team up and big battle, but none the less this movie accomplishes what ever it has set out to do. the parody is there, the writing is descent, and the over plot is satisfying. your obviously thinking "well whats wrong with the movie" the problem with this movie is the same problem with spiderman 3. it was all there and potential existed it just didn;t play out to what it could've been. overall it was a good movie.

It's a shame this movie had to come out after Meet the Spartans, when everyone lost hope in spoof movies, causing this to bomb. People, this movie is made the way spoof movies are supposed to be done! This had Airplane and Naked Gun written all over it!1. other than a few references like iWhatever and "you're not in my top 5 anymore" this movie does not focus on pop culture, it focuses on jokes based on the movies it's spoofing! No Paris or Britney in here, just nice creative jokes. One of my favorites being the Hourglass getting glass in his eye and a clever way of spoofing the "hiding on the ceiling" scene from Spiderman.2.Meet the Spartans was basically what would happen if you had a 5 year old rewrite 300. This movie takes things from the first Spiderman movie and creates a new plot at the same time! Dragonfly is quite the creative substitute for Spiderman, and the Hourglass is actually a cool enough villain that he should be in an actual superhero movie! It just felt good watching an original plot rather than a "dumb downed 100 IQ points" version of the spoofed movie. 3. While there is a spoof of BatmanBegins, a five minute scene of X-Men and a quick Fantastic Four spoof,this movie revolves around Spiderman's plot and that plot only! Not all over the place like Epic Movie or Meet the Spartans. 4. Cast is great. Well, what's a good spoof movie with Leslie Nielsen? Even in his 80s, the man will leave you in stitches. Never saw Drake Bell in anything before this movie, but I can see some bright spots in his future. And Christopher MacDonald is always good at playing a humorous bad guy,what a fitting role for him. Some awesome cameos too, such as Dan Castelleneta (voice of Homer Simpson), Tracey Morgan, and more.Such a shame this bombed and Meet the Spartans succeeded at the BO. David Zucker, don't trust those numbers. You, along with Mel Brooks, will always be the master of true spoof movies. Your movies will be forever quoted ("Don't call me Shirley") and remembered, while Meet the Spartans fades as the pop culture stuff it spoofs fades too. Just hopefully there is some young future filmmaker out there who goes by his style more.

Some people were going like this movie was directed by David zucker who directed airplane! well he only produced this.that's all he did. But truthfully I found this funnier than scary movie 3 and 4. To tell you the truth I find this better than the spider-man movies. This movie starred drake bell and he played the spider-man part. Because people are going this is a spoof, this is a spoof of all the superhero movies, no no no no NO!It's just a spoof of Spider-man, and one or two spoofs of other things. well this movie brought back leslie nielsen. Make sure you stay out for the credits, there's about 20minutes of cut scenes in the credits to pad the movies out, i think its about an hour 10 minutes. Its longer than meet the spartans. its the 3rd funniest along with scary movie 1 and 2. The man in character gets bit by a dragonfly. Drake bell did good stuff in this too. Him and josh are doing good stuff like josh was in drillbit taylor and drakes doing really well too. its the best thing I've seen in a while,i know its a spoof but it felt like a real superhero movie at certain points, and dragonflys really a cool character, i would actually like to see a comic of him. i know its not like spider-man. If you don't like it, i don't know why not it was really good, best spoof since scary movie 1 & 2 10/10

This kind of Airplane/Naked Gun style parody film exploded in popularity in the 00's, and most of them were quite awful. Superhero movie never comes close to reaching the comedic heights of Airplane or Naked Gun, but it's a bit better than many of its contemporary wannabes.Sticking mostly to the Sam Raimi Spider-Man movies, Superhero Movie does a fair job of grabbing the low hanging comedic fruit and occasionally hitting a few inspired high notes; most of them courtesy of the legendary Leslie Nielsen. A few other notable pros do yeoman's work and the young cast do okay with what they're given. But there's little here to recommend unless you just happen to be a big fan of the genre(s) and feel a need to sorta be a completest.

reviews.review_title: i regretted not to watching this movie for so long time
reviews.content: This is a solid spoof film. This genre is not for everyone as you can see from the rating. That is why you should always check few reviews before skipping a movie. I am glad for other enthusiastic reviews here and I would recommend this movie to anyone who likes Naked Gun, Airplane or Family Guy :).
Laugh is what was missing in life but this movie made me laugh it's a silly funny movie , don't think about logic only enjoy thats it.Very funny movie.

reviews.review_title: Worst Movie I've Ever Seen! Waist of Time and Money!
reviews.content: Went with some friends and one of my friends mom, thinking it would be a good way to start off the spring break, but the movie turned out awful. We all agree it shouldn't have been PG-13. More like R material. Lots of sexual dialog, cussing and referring to boy and girl parts (below the waist). Not worth the time or money. Strongly urge you not to go, or rent it when it comes out. If you do end up going, don't take smaller children. Not the type of movie to see with the family! If curious about the content, check out the content advisory section on the Superhero Movie page on IMDb. Most of the content that was meant to be funny was extremely crude. Especially when they make fun of Steven Hawking.
Well it is better than other scary movies sequels it was funny to kinda
This film bites off more it can chew. Very cringe jokes and the acting was amateur

reviews.review_title: Lame, unnecessary spoof runs out of steam
reviews.content: When I was very young a film called Airplane came out, and I loved it. I was ten years old, and even though I had never seen most of the disaster movies that it spoofed, I couldn't get enough of the film's rapid-fire visual gags. The spoof genre of movies has been around pretty much since then, from the sequel Airplane 2 to TV detective spoof The Naked Gun, right up to modern equivalents such as the Scary Movie series, Epic Movie and the pretty universally despised Meet The Spartans.But it was the writers Jim Abrahams and David Zucker who started it with Airplane, and now they have come to reclaim the spoof title with Superhero Movie. As the name suggests, the new target of ridicule is the superhero movie genre, exemplified by Spiderman and X-Men. The bulk of the plot is taken from Spiderman, featuring a young outcast who is bitten by a genetically enhanced dragonfly and who takes on some of the characteristics of the insect. Scenes from the original are lifted wholesale, such as the scene where the hero first discovers that he can climb walls, and the part where his uncle (played by Airplane veteran, Leslie Nielsen) is shot by an escaping burglar. Grafted onto this stolen plot are a number of jokes and ludicrous situations which, on the whole, are not very amusing.This it is an example of the laziest type of movie making. For example, as Dragonfly climbs up the wall, a cat walks past him to highlight the fact that the camera has simply been turned on its side to give the illusion of sticking to the surface. I seem to remember Kenny Everett doing that joke over 25 years ago. One scene attempts to wring over a minute's worth of laughs out of an old lady breaking wind. And whereas the Airplane movies had jokes almost every second, Superhero Movie runs out of steam very quickly and the jokes, feeble as they are, are very thinly spread. The film only lasts an hour and ten minutes, and it seems likely that this is because they simply couldn't think of anything else to say.It seems that these spoofs have not moved on since I was ten. If anything, they have gone backwards. Maybe that would mean that they are suitable for 8 year olds, but the rating on Superhero Movie specifies that it is only suitable for teenagers. It stands to reason that they would have to be very stupid teenagers.

So, after all these years full with terrible parodies and new members in this business I was afraid before this movie. I thought, yes this would be another sh*t... And see what happened! I Haven't seen something good like this since the "Naked Gun" and "Hot Shots". OK, the story isn't good enough but this is a movie parody with a lot of good humor and that's the point! The humor works! The actors with master Nielsen too! It's nice to see him again in his best form! I've had fun all the time! There are of course some hard things but I think this kind of movie is only watchable with some stuff like these. So, I say, it's worth to see!!! I'm not kidding!!!

Just watched this and haven't laughed at some scenes this much in a long time. Liked the story and character.s. It was entertaining and fun! Have watched a few scenes multiple times getting a good laugh.Well done to the team who put this together.
Such a great comedy, a true laugh-riot each time i watch it. Leslie Nielsen as always in a league of his own. A must-see to put it shortly.

Not a bad spoof, I just wish it would have had more to it. The filming and acting was really good compared to most parodies I've seen. The movie basically follows a parody of Spiderman with a little batman twist. It does throw in a few other heroes, but you only see them for a split moment. It would have been nice if the movie would have been spread out with more jokes about other superhero films. There is a wide verity of them out there so it should have been easy to do.. The movie did a great job following the spider man movie pretty closely tho, mocking every scene to some degree, some of the jokes were cringe, but most were done tastefully.

reviews.review_title: Not that bad, not so good...
reviews.content: Well, OK! it IS better then scary movies, epic movie or meet the spartans, but it's not even close to Zuckers' movies and even Leslie Nielsen can't save this...You definitely WILL laugh here and there, and some jokes are really good...But again, we have here same toilet-humor that is overused in on these spoof movies... just why some people don't understand, that some things are not funny, but just disgusting...And NO! showing the scene where one insults a dead body in it's coffin isn't funny too, it is not only disgusting, but immoral; This movie is NOT complete waste of time, watch it if you have nothing else to do, but if you DO have something other on mind, don't bother, skip it, you will not miss much...

Okay so with David Zucker attached to this film (only as a producer), a lot of people may have heard the name and mistaken this for one of his actual films. Well be warned, this is one of those cheap nasty "comedies" that try and con people into the theaters and then just spew out regurgitated comedy by numbers while hardly deviating from the plot of whatever movie they have chosen to parody (or rip off may be better). This is not a touch even on the weaker Zucker films of later years and seems to be from the minds of people that have only heard of comedy but never really understood how it works. Shame on Zucker for putting his name on this rubbish.If that wasn't bad enough, this movie is a parody of the first spiderman movie. Yes the one that came out six years ago and has had two sequels since then. So it doesn't even manage to be topical. Had this come out in 2003 it may have at least scored points for being relevant (which would have still made the film disposable with no chance of anyone remembering it years later, but for the first viewing some of the direct parody may have amused people briefly). Sure they threw in the odd additional hero, but only as quick visual gags with no real depth and most of those characters were direct copies of the characters they parodied and played out the most obvious jokes. Essentially the film is a highly stripped down copy of Spiderman with a handful of jokes thrown in.Of course we should have suspected. When they were hyping this they talked about it like it was the first superhero comedy, while that is a long way from the mark. My suggestion if you want to see an actually good superhero comedy is to check out "Mystery Men" instead.Finally a word about Leslie Nielson. You should have figured by now that Leslie will pretty much do anything. While his skill at delivering any line or action with a straight face is second to none, that ability alone doesn't make for good comedy. He needs the right script and like many of his comedies this wasn't it. Having said that, he is still probably the funniest thing in this movie, but then he could have achieved that had he just stood in an empty room and read a bus time table to us.

reviews.review_title: Not bad. Not bad at all.
reviews.content: Superhero movie is one of those films that you cannot judge by normal film standards. As a film, it's ... well ... passable. Just. If you judge it as a spoof, it isn't passable. Its bloomin' marvellous.Superhero movie is full of some of the most spontaneous and genuine humour that we've seen recently from the filmmakers, and is somewhat of a return to form. They haven't done anything nearly this funny since Scary Movie 3, and I hope that they continue along these lines because the writers proved with Scary Movie and Scary Movie 3 that they can do it, they just don't do it enough.And on that point, it's annoying that their other movies have been so awful. But having said that, the movies they send up are perfect, Spiderman, X-Men, and Fantastic Four had it coming frankly. When this film is on a roll, very few others can top it. The sequence in the laboratory is hilarious and full of surprise, and the send up of Professor Xavier and the mutant mansion is great fun to watch. Leslie Nielsen is as sharp as ever and Chris Macdonald has some great lines, especially the hero/villain sparring with Drake Bell. The humour is puerile at times but there is enough good to outweigh the bad.

This movie is a very good spoof movie and definitely one of my favorites. Now thanks to the two laughing joking numb nuts known as Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, spoof movies (mainly ones with "Movie" in the title) have been giving a bad name. For that reason, many didn't give this one a chance. But, this was written by Craig Mazin, who I like as a writer (except Scary Movie 4). Now yesterday, 02 July, 2008, I went to see this with my dad. I liked it and so did he. The reason I think this worked and something like "Meet the Spartans" didn't is because Mazin see's the movies he's spoofing unlike Friedberg and Seltzer who only see the trailer (and I'm not joking about that). Mazin focuses on one movie this time (Spider-Man 1) and he makes jokes about certain scene's and moments (like when Spider-Man is bleeding, in this Dragonfly has to pee.) Where Friedberg and Seltzer make the same joke over and over again (kicking the celebrity's into the pit from 300). So, yeah, see this movie but don't see anything by Friedberg and Seltzer.
Why rate it so low? It's absolutely hilarious, not once did I stop laughing! A film that you can never get bored of. Highly recommend!!

reviews.review_title: Comedy take on Spider-Man 2002 and X-men
reviews.content: Worth watching some good jokes and makes you think the idea of spiderman is kind of stupid but we invested our childhood watching the cartoons and it seems normal. Not Leslie Niesens best movie but he still makesme laugh.

I'll make this review rather simple and keep each point brief. Just like the film itself....Tired humour: After seeing a lot of spoof films, I believe this film sticks to the genres standard formula. Something that, if this film didn't follow it, may have done it more justice. I've thought for a while that this genre of film needs some breathing space; after releases of other terrible titles such as: Meet the Spartans and Epic Movie. The jokes have become overused and I found myself almost tutting more than laughing. Casting is TERRIBLE: I myself, don't believe that Drake Bell and Sara Paxton's acting skills stretch to outlandish and ridiculous humour of say the likes of Anna Faris from the original Scary Movie titles. Since you spend the majority of the film dealing with them, it ended up being rather disappointing. The good cast of the film make brief appearances: I don't think ANY of the characters were utilised well in the film really. The funniest of characters played, what I consider to be, minor roles. Leslie Nielson and Regina Hall in particular. In that respect, if you're a fan of previous films like Scary Movie and see from the promo posters online and on the DVD cover that Regina Hall makes an appearance, please take note that it's a 2 minute one and was probably one of the only funny moments from the film.All in all, I would say avoid this one. It will be a wasted 80 minutes and if it's laughs you're after - you'd be safer watching Scary Movie again. 3/10

well thats the worst film i have seen in a while if i wasn't in the middle of loads of people i would of walked out. i didn't once laugh it was WAY to predictable. i enjoy spoof films like aeroplane and nakedgun but this was just poor don't waste your money on it trust me you wont be missing much. the boy in the lead role Drake Bell cant act in this film to save his life he should just stick to drake and josh I'm a fan of Leslie Nielsen but he should just cross this film of his CV .well what I'm getting at is don't waste your time or money on a film which will leave you felling riped off this film is not on for long but it does seem to drag and your end up just wishing it to end

Superhero Movie is one of my favorite movies to date. It's hilarious! They make references to several other heroes but, obviously, in a parodic way. Drake Bell -- surprisingly -- was great, and it felt like it took all the cliches in comics and used them to make the masterpiece that is Superhero Movie.It was a great way to just relax and have lots of laughs.I love the relationships between all the characters, especially Rick's aunt and uncle. Kevin Hart's character is hilarious as well, and his relationship with Rick is flawless.Basically, the movie is the epitome of perfection.

This movie is funny if you're the gentleman who was sitting about three rows behind me (repeating every punchline, laughing when there were no gags on-screen, and issuing a gravelly "haaaa" at every scene involving a computer or mobile device).For everyone else, it's a mean-spirited, bungled "comedy." The movie strictly follows the formula of the later "Scary Movie" films, as well as "Epic Movie" and "Meet the Spartans," though without the flood of heartless pop culture references that made the latter two so irritating. Still, the lampooning of intellectual and peacemaking figures the world over makes it clear that the film knows its audience: people who envy brainpower. "Superhero Movie" is particularly and consistently nasty to Stephen Hawking, introducing him as a sex-starved druggie and using his disability as a vehicle for slapstick.The plot is based on "Spider-Man," with "Batman Begins" and "X-Men" thrown in just to deliver some physical comedy. Much of the movie is slapstick, but not in any invigorating or interesting way. The longest-running gag is a fart joke, and early on the scriptwriters seem to believe that having the main character get thrown in conspicuous piles of fake animal poo automatically enlivens an otherwise uninspired rehash of the spider bite scene from "Spider-Man." Perhaps the only redeeming feature of this feature is the energy in it, notably absent in other recent parodies. The filmmakers act as though they're doing something new, and the audience can feel the influence in the way the actors bounce around the screen. An extremely abbreviated length (about an hour and fifteen minutes) and the zest of the presentation makes "Superhero Movie" tolerable rather than horrifying.
Watch this movie and find out. I thought this was a pretty good film, and it had some comedic moments in the plot that , well the whole thing had me laughing opening credits to closing credits

The outro went on, and on, and on. Ruined the feel good of the ending of a movie. One set of out takes would have worked, two sets were way too much. The worst part was, the viewer eventually realises they are deleted scenes, not outtakes.

I went to this movie with my kids because we LOVE Drake and Josh. Imagine my embarrassment as we sat through crude stupid joke after crude stupid joke. We got up and walked out. Drake Bell should be embarrassed- this is not the way to transition from teen TV star to movie star - look to Justin Long for an example of how to do it. I thought for sure with names like Marion Ross and the guy from airplane that the jokes would at least be funny. And sure, I went in knowing there would be bad words - but it was degrading to women and just plain stupid. The plot was dumb. The acting was SO bad - good acting could have helped. I plan on telling all my friends how bad this movie was.
But it still wasn't a funny movie by any means. It was possibly one of this director's worst

reviews.review_title: Average and in the spoof genre that is a lot of praise
reviews.content: This movie I am willing to admit gave me a few good laughs here and there, but overall is not very good. A lot of the jokes aren't very good, but as said said some do work. It feels a lot more like the Scary Movies than Friedberg/Seltzer Movies. That is a very good thing. The actors don't really do a good job. Drake Bell just wasn't very funny. The effects are not good at all, but just like jokes and acting compared to other spoof movies this is good. One joke I hated was one about Stephen Hawking. They make fun of his illness, and make themselves look like very cruel people. Overall it isn't good, and it isn't bad it is just average, and that's saying a lot.2 stars out of 4

Ever since Scary Movie no one has really been able to make a funny and satirical movie. However Craig Mazin makes a return with Superhero movie. And the compelling force of this film is Drake Bell. We all know him as Drake Parker on Drake and Josh and he makes this film better. Superhero movie is far more better than the other parody movies such as Date Movie, by having many more jokes and by making more sense. Typical spoofs usually jam every pop culture aspect together and expect it to be funny. Superhero Move, however, is a bit smarter and also has Leslie Nelson in it, who is famous for his satirical movies. He was very funny in this film. Overall Superhero Movie by itself is not a stand out movie, but compared to the others in the same genre, it's very good.

I enjoyed Tobey Maguire's version of Spider-Man over the newer stuff so this was fun spoof.
Mixing the X-Men was even better.

At first after watching this movie I was lost for words..now after the first chock has left me I'm able to make my first and only comment....Oh My God Why? Why why why? There is so much to do in this beautiful world. There is so much to see.Why do we have to spoil everything with war, greed and absolutely worthless movies such as Superhero Movie??? It's not just BAD it's Embarrassing...The idea of this movie had the best intentions, but somehow the script is not nearly enough to suit as a blockbuster...the jokes are lame and the laughs are easy to count.I wanted it to be good, I really did, but after watching it I just want my money back. But I would be too ashamed walking back to the store since they would then know that I've seen the damned movie. I'd rather return a bag full of rented porn or sit through a Leonardo di Caprio movie-marathon..(no offense Leonardo)Don't Rent, Watch or Support in anyway movie-company that provide the market with movies like this!

Seeing these kinds of movies in the theaters with friends is fun, but watching them at home isn't. This movie was a little better than I had expected it to be. I was it with some friends which made the movie a little better. The acting in this movie is the same as all the scary movie, epic movie, etc, but the actors were much better than the other movies. I was surprised to see Drake Bell as the main character and a few new, funnier actors. The president from the scary movies is also a main character. This movie contained not so many funny scenes, but the ones that were funny were hilarious. Not too many in your face sex jokes, but that is a good thing in this movie. See this movie only once, because the next time you see it , it won't be funny.

reviews.review_title: Good Spoof movie..not bad at all..
reviews.content: I have really enjoyed it very much and lot of stomach paining laughable in there.. Go and watch it..

reviews.review_title: Back in the Saddle for Zucker and Weiss. Entertaining Fluff!
reviews.content: While you watch the Regency spoof series (Meet the Spartans, Epic-Date Movies), you wish they had the spark of The Zucker-Abrams-Zucker classics like 'Naked Gun' and 'High School High' along with the brilliant "Top Secret". "Superhero Movie" has all the right stuff, good writer/director Craig(The Specials)Mazin, great producers (Robert K. Weiss and David Zucker from Kentucky Fried Movie fame).Casting of great character actors like old ham Leslie Nielson, Marion Ross, and excellent Christopher McDonald make this a very funny spoof that is rushed and at times unfunny. The result is a hit and miss comedy that has more laughs in 5 minutes than all of the Regency spoofs together. A send up of all the comic book movie in the past 7 years, and the set-ups for re staging the scenes from them with a comic twist is damn good. Where the laughs fall flat are the guest stars (Pam Anderson- Tracy Morgan- Regina Hall) in an "X-Men" detour. The older actors and the unknown leads are hilarious. Better than the last 2 'Scary Movies' but not on par with the best of Z-A-Z boys on their weakest films. Loved seeing Robert(Airplane)Hayes back with Zucker again in a great parody of Batman's dads death. Wait for the end credits and a pack of outtakes. PS... The best laughs come from Robert Joy as Stephen Hawkings.... He just sits there and gets huge belly laughs. make a movie just for HIM.

reviews.review_title: The best stupid movie I've seen since Kung Pow
reviews.content: I loved this movie! At first I thought it would just be another stupid movie, but like Kung Pow I actually liked it more each time I've seen it.I loved Lesly Nelson talking about how the super heroes always get the b!tches, how Marion Ross had the farting scene, or how she says "shave your pubes dear, no one wants to go down on a tumbleweed". I was literally in tears laughing at some of this material.Once again, if you love stupid movies (the good ones at least) you'll like this movie.All the people who gave Kung Pow high marks because you found it way funnier the 2nd or 3rd time you watched it do yourselves a favor and watch this movie again. Make sure you have some tissues with you.

reviews.review_title: If you appreciated Airplane or Naked Gun you will like this movie
reviews.content: I saw a couple of the Scary Movies and Meet the Spartans. You can tell they aren't in the class of Airplane or Top Secret. I didn't even watch all of the Scary Movies and I haven't bothered seeing Epic Movie thinking I would be equally disappointed.But like Top Secret and the Naked Gun series I enjoyed this movie. There were a couple scenes where I took an untimely mouthful of popcorn and had to keep from choking or spitting it up. (It was good popcorn) My cheeks and ribs were sore, and my daughter and I laughed about the movie on the drive home. There are some scenes now that I will still smile about thinking back.I was pleasantly surprised and have recommended it to those that were like me and doubted it at first.

Rick Riker is a geeky kid, a pervert, and an orphan, basically. He lives with his Aunt Lucille and Uncle Albert. The main film is a parody of Spiderman from 2002, with references to Batman Begins (2005) and Fantastic Four (2005) and Xmen (2006). SPOILER Rick gets bitten by a dragonfly on a class field trip after being sexually attacked by a ton of animals. He then becomes a superhero, sort of. SPOILER There was a lot of profanity in this movie, like plenty of sh*ts, and a loud use of the f bomb towards the end. SPOILER Aunt Lucille died, and Uncle Albert died and came back to life. Kind of a movie, not for kids under the age of eleven or twelve. There is no nudity. But their is a lot of cussing. Really funny film, better than all the other parody films I've seen.

Superhero Movie (2008) is the most recent in the long line over "parody" movie movies which I despise so much. I wish this movie could be the death of the genre, but I know that it isn't awful enough to put the final nail in the coffin.If Meet the Spartans is considered the bottom of the barrel as far as Hollywood movies go, than Superhero Movie is probably near the top. Unfortunately Meet the Spartans was actually miles below the barrel, and this movie just barely makes it in.Superhero Movie has a decent cast of C-list celebs. It's got Drake Bell (the kid from Disney's Drake and Josh), Leslie Nielson (Airplane!), Tracy Morgan (SNL and 30 Rock), and a few others scattered throughout. Although it has the star power to light a 40-watt bulb, the movie fails to utilize any humor.This movie is about 80 minutes long, most of which is dedicated to following the Spiderman plot, and not one single joke is funny. I didn't laugh or chuckle or smirk the entire time.Don't see this movie. Don't even think about it. For the love of cinema, just skip it and maybe they wont come out with another one....oh, who am I kidding? They'll probably come out with another one by fall.

This was the stupidest movie I have ever seen in my life. It is a complete waste of money and time. I went to see this movie with my friends and when the movie was over not a single person in the movie theater- not that there was a lot of people there to see this terrible movie- said "wow what a good movie." Someone actually walked out! It was absolutely terrible! It was disgusting and I hated every minute of it. My friend was putting her head in my shoulder towards the end because after the scene with Rick on the ceiling peeing, she had had enough. It was not funny at all. Believe me I went with 11 other girls and not one of my friends liked it. It was ridiculous! I've seen many movies but this was absolutely the worst! I mean a scene in the movie is with an old man making out with a dead person in a coffin. I just can't make up these things.

And that's alright. I loved Meet The Spartans and this one is also a pretty good entry in the 'parody' genre. Of course it's not comparable to classics such as "Airplane" or "Naked Gun" but this movie is not deserving of such low marks and reviews.OK, the actors are not that great and the plot is just a rehash of Spiderman with a few other Superhero movies. Some jokes are way too long and fall flat, but the ones that work are pretty good. And it's all so ridiculous you can't help but laugh and go along with the stupidity. If you like silly parodies look no further. I was a bit depressed and after watching this I was laughing a lot, so it does its job. Not a laugh-fest, but not a dud either, give it a chance. And watching Leslie Nielsen is always a treat.6/10

reviews.review_title: Surprisingly good, not to be underestimated.
reviews.content: After the horrible bottom feeders Date Movie, Epic Movie, and Meet the Spartans many people may be turned off from another spoof in the vein of Scary Movie. But in reality New Regency's idiot duo Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, the two who brought us the garbage mentioned earlier in this review, weren't even behind it. Instead it was brought from Dimension film's own Craig Mazin, the mind behind Scary Movie 3 and 4.But that's not the only reason not to or TO see it, we have the legendary Leslie Nielsen (from Airplane and Naked Gun stardom) co-starring in a role that isn't unlike the films that made him a star. We also have the charismatic Drake Bell fresh off Drake and Josh fame. The obligatory cameos by Pamela Anderson and Tracy Morgan are nothing to get excited about, they make brief, insignificant appearances that aren't what the movie's about. This film is about spoofing SUPERHERO movies, if you already didn't know! And they do a fine job. Even if the attempt is sometimes a hit and miss.I really can't lie though, even though I had preconceived notions about this flick, I was very entertained. Scene after scene (mostly spoofing the Spiderman trilogy) kept me laughing and laughing until I was actually in pain. Some jokes, most the ones involving flatulence, farting to the simpleton, fell flat and seemed unsophisticatedly forced. But the rest is actually felt fresh and new. I couldn't help but love scenes that provided comedic "What if?" scenarios of scenes from Spiderman and X-Men. The best in which have Drake Bell undergo the sickening transformation into "The Dragonfly", and even a twist of the famous wall climbing scene from Spiderman where he realizes something just isn't right.But this film likes to stay within a decent realm of pertinence, rather than choose random people in pop culture and play off them like caricatures. With Leslie Nielsen at Bell's side we get an authenticity not usually found in spoofs anymore. We do get a Tom Cruise parody that at first feels out of place, but eventually grows on you. A perfect impression by Miles Fisher is what we get, and he does such a good job of mimicking his mannerisms you could sware he was a skinny version of Frank Caliendo.Will this film rejuvinate the genre, absolutely not. Will it make lots of money? Yes! But hopefully not only from idiotic, hormonally challenged teenie boppers. Hopefully some people will give it a chance. Even if for only 50 minutes of it's 85 minute running time we get a fun and refreshingly original sleeper. One of the best spoofs in over half a decade!

Without giving away any boilers this movie as just as much of a train wreck as I'm sure the creator is envisioned it would be. It's parodies at its best are not funny and unoriginal and at worst tremendously homophobic, transphobic, and misogynistic. There was a couple moments where there was some X-Men jokes that gave me a small chuckle just because I haven't seen too many of those before what's Spider-Man's dog has just been done so many times it's hard to consider any apart they were doing to be the slightest bit originally funny. Some of the actors casted who are actually good actors get there lol with the strip they have been given but I must say that some of the actors in this movie especially some of the main actors are just out right bad And do nothing for the film.We just the production value was so good and I didn't get a couple laughs with the X-Men stuff I didn't give it a one star. I would never talk to anybody about this movie unless I was talking about a list of some of the worst movies I've ever seen with very little redeeming quality.
Thought this was a funny spoof on super hero movies I liked it

reviews.review_title: OOPS, a horrible taste of humour.
reviews.content: Let me tell you one thing Believe me this, if you laugh watching this movie you have a horrible taste of humour, lol, no I'm serious.How do you rate 10/10 on a movie which is full of fantasy jokes like a kids movie and laugh on it. Think about it lmao. Rate Jurassic world 10/10 at least rather rating a community who gives 10 to a movie like this , well , that's very funny.

Okay we all know Date Movie, Epic Movie, Meet The Spartans etc.. are some of the worst spoofs, and some of the worst comedies ever made, they are only watchable thanks to some semi- decent production value, a general wackiness for when you're in the mood to watch something silly, and talented cast members doing their best with some god awful jokes.. they're bad spoofs end of story.But Superhero Movie actually made me laugh, and is easily the best of these types of spoofs, maybe in great part to the new teaming of director Mazin and producer Zucker. The laugh a minute formula is actually employed, unlike in the other movies where laugh a minute means either breaking out into some hip hop fueled dance routine, some lame 'parody' or just doing something completely off the wall and hoping it gets a laugh.Don't judge this movie by the 'Movie' suffix, if you're in the mood for something silly give this one a chance, you might be pleasantly surprised.

reviews.review_title: Not hilarious....But at least it's better then recent spoofs.
reviews.content: I'm sure you all heard the criticism hitting this movie, but sometimes you have to ignore it and see for yourself. While watching this movie i realised why it get's the criticism , it's a poorly executed spoof, however saying that, it managed to get a few laughs out of me every now and then, and i had to admit, it was mildly entertaining. But is entertainment enough from a spoof? The acting was good enough, nothing disappointing in that sort of department. But disappointing in the movie as a whole.If your going to compare this to all these other recent spoof movies like Epic movie, Date Movie and Meet The Spartans. You would see that Superhero movie stands out by a landslide, in many different qualities. We all agree spoof movies these day's are nothing like the one's they used to make. But let's not move into that to much, let's just say if your considering watching this movie don't expect a classic hilarious spoof like the "Scary Movie." Because i could almost guarantee it won't be on that level. So just go to see it with a open mind and no major expectation, then it's should give you some laughs.

reviews.review_title: The least awful of the Seltzer and Friedberg movies
reviews.content: Superhero Movie is the Least awful of the infamously low-art "Movie" movies. But even then, it's not saying much, since all the positives are slightly bare minimum. The problems of its predecessors and successors are still here, an unfocused story with low substance and really bad effects. But by and large, Superhero Movie is by far the most consistent spoof in S&F's catalogue, focusing squarely on the eponymous genre at the time. Drake Bell and Leslie Nielsen provide surprisingly good performances as the hero and villain. The humor, while still overrelying on lazy pop culture references and gross comedy, does have some real good hits.But while this film is being reevaluated as a better contemporary, I personally think that this movie is still slightly below average.

reviews.review_title: Mediocre Comedy Balances Funny and Goofy
reviews.content: Superhero Movie is very odd. Anyone who's seen these Scary Movie spin offs where the movie is a series off topical jokes relating to a movie genre know that they have not been too good lately. This movie surprised me with the fact that I laughed much more than I thought I would. There was a lot of dumb moments that kind of spoil it but I guess it might just be for a different crowd.There are a few well written jokes, and a couple of decent acting jobs. Kevin Hart was funny as always. Leslie Nielsen was a little on the slapstick side but brought his famous personality to it. Sara Paxton almost seemed to pretty and took the movie very seriously. She almost seemed like she was playing an actual part in a hero movie.The real flaws of this movie are when it lulled with sad attempts at jokes and poorly executed goofy moments. Almost every movie in this line has those attempted goofy moments that the self assigned mature audience will dislike, but even some dumb moments made me laugh.I would recommend Superhero Movie to anyone who enjoys comedy and doesn't mind a bunch of moments where the movie lags into dumb comedy.

reviews.review_title: funny movie but female lead is not
reviews.content: This movie has a lot of laugh out loud moments and fun cameos... it should have been as well rated as the scary movies series but poor casting really sinks it. The female lead is no Anna Faris, shes not pretty like her or funny or able to carry a scene on her own because her performance is so weak and forgettable. She literally never makes a joke, like you might as well take a bathroom break every time she has a scene but youd spend half the movie in the bathroom if you did because she gets more screen time than interesting or funny people like kevin hart or leslie nielson. They even have Regina Hall do a cameo like just to remind of what this movie is really missing and rub it in your face! So all the gags are there and all the celebrities just like scary movie, only minus the funny female leads that make them memorable and classic.

If someone says it is bad, because its stupid, then he is an id-... I mean that person is stupid. It looks like that, because it is supposed to look like that. Its a P A R O D Y, thats why. I really enjoyed it, well, ending sucks a little bit but rest of it? Pure awesomeness. It makes fun of every superhero movie that i was watching when i was growing up (Raimi spidermans trilogy, xmen, fantastic 4, batman etc). And ofc Nielsen, one of my favourite actors is there so it had to be marvelous.

reviews.review_title: Basically a "take the mick" out of Spiderman, movie.
reviews.content: This film was EXCELLENT. You cannot go one minute without having something to laugh at. Even during romantic, sad and tragic scenes there are things to make you crack up. Just the whole idea of a dragon-fly guy makes you burst out with laughter. I liked the way this film was almost identical to Spiderman but twisted to make it much more entertaining. The fact that the film wasn't very logical made it very good too. I mean at one point the "dragon-fly guy" is in his room and the casually dressed "hourglass" goes looking for him. Dragon-fly attaches himself to the ceiling and starts to pee when Hourglass isn't looking. I mean how can you not notice someone peeing from above. Just the smell would be enough to raise suspicion. But these points are a bonus and make the film as good as it is.

reviews.review_title: Rubbish on toast with a side of rubbish
reviews.content: I'm lost for words.There is only so far these parody movies can go- Scary Movie set the ball rolling and continued with a few sequels (Getting worse with each one) then a few more crawled out that went sour very quickly, Date Movie and Epic Movie...Crap. We thought things may be looking up with the half baked, could have been better attempt for Meet the Spartans but then Superhero Movie crawled out of the toxic waste dump.Spiderman takes the parody ass kicking of this film, and it does stick to the real story line pretty well. Sure there are a few laughs in this, none of which i'll mention (it'll ruin the film).Cast is excellent, ideas were there but not executed, but all in all, it falls very flat.2 Stars just for trying.Download the trailer off Youtube and save your money.

This film was the worst film I have ever seen. It was a complete waste of money. If I had not been in the cinema was my two young cousins (who also thought it was disappointing, but not as terrible as I thought), I would have left the cinema. There were two points in the film that I almost laughed, but the rest of it was either boring, ridiculous or painful. I thought it would be a spoof on all superhero movies (which I love), but in fact it was mainly based on Spiderman, with a few oblique references to other superhero movies such as Fantastic Four and Batman. I really cannot think of one good thing to say about this film. Do not waste your money with this film-there are many other better films out there!

reviews.review_title: biggest waste of £4.50 of my life
reviews.content: please do not waste your time with this film. i suppose they are just going to keep shooting out these movies. effortless acting, effortless script and just damn right awful. to give you an idea of how bad it was, i rate it worse than scary movie 4. now that's saying something! they didn't even go in to any detail about any other superheros except spider-man - "the dragonfly". it really annoyed me as on the poster it showed lots of characters but it was severely centered on the dragonfly. and this was not a good thing. i had actually considered walking out of the cinema after i saw the cast at the start. i don't even know why i saw it in the first place now! i think that the film's main problem was the overuse of slapstick comedy. it seemed that they relied on this to carry the film through. appalling to be honest!

And so it started with "Shreik" a send up of horror films, then we had Scary Movie, a genuinely good attempt at a new kind of genre, the illustrious send up. however....now we have: Scary Movie* Scary Movie 2 Scary Movie 3 Scary Movie 4* Date Movie Meet The Spartans Not Another Team movie* plus many more (genuinely funny movies marked with *)and.....Super hero movie.... it seems the people that make these movies cannot yet grasp what makes the send-ups funny. using the rip-offs from other movies in a funny way is all well and good if done properly, but not many producers seem to know how to do that. Scary movie(1) did it well, the following sequels were then horrendous as the tried to over play the franchise, but it was redeemed by Scary Movie 4. Not another teen movie was good because it used the spoofs well...and to its credit i am sick of teen movies. however, this movie plays like a bad version of all of these. it relies on slap stick the would make even the 3 stooges cringe, violating the image of Stephen hawking, and then when people begin to get bored (and the producers knew when this would be) we are treated to Pamela Anderson in a skin tight suit. to conclude, spoofs should be about making a homage-like mock-up of an original movie with an original storyline, not plastering random take offs of legitimate film onto the storyline of a real film. ...i shudder at the thought of "SCI-FI MOVIE" and get my seppuku knife ready

reviews.review_title: Wow, I got exactly what I wanted!
reviews.content: So I was sitting at home the other day and thought, what would be the best way to spend eight dollars without having any fun? So my friend and I were sitting on the couch and there was a preview for Superhero Movie and she said "Hey, why don't we go see that! It looks like a piece of crap and thats just what you were looking for!" So i was like "Yalets go to that crappy movie, i could spend eight dollars on food and cloths, but ill spend it on seeing the crappy movie!" So we get there and sat down, then the movie started. I was already thinking "Good job Joe, you found a horrible movie to see!" But it got even worse when i saw drake bell was it it. So I was like "YES! CRAPPY ACTORS!" I knew this was going to be the worst movie ever, and I was right. They added so much senseless overplayed humor, IT WAS GREAT! Overall, i really hated this movie very much and it was exactly the thing i was looking for to waste eight dollars on.So if you're having a bad day and you wanna torture yourself further and lose eight dollars in the process, go out and see Superhero Movie!

You may think it is a bad movie, but in 2020 context, surprisingly, if you are older than 22, you'll find it funny for sure.
I strongly recommend to give it a try again and to not remember the first time you watched it.
Trust me. Worth it.

reviews.review_title: Saw it first time 15 years later and it isn't so bad
reviews.content: I think the low rating is reasonable considering the movie was made in 2008. Back then, the market was flooded with parody movies following the success of Scary Movie. Movie history had a lot of parody films but they were usually decent quality and separated by years. Then between 2005-2008 there were at least 15 big parody titles and the genre pretty much became boring and repetitive.So, I didn't see this movie till the time I wrote this review (2023). I don't think it's any worse than other spoof titles of this era - a plot line that makes fun of all major superhero movies made till that point (mind you this was before Marvel so they really didn't have a lot of source material - only Spider-Man, Batman and X-men). The punchlines aren't always clever and the acting isn't always perfect but this exactly was why other spoof titles of the time were successful.Overall, I thought this was an entertaining movie. We laughed out loud a few times (particularly Leslie Nielsen's lines and performance).I think this is worth watching if you're in the mood for a totally stupid parody comedy.
Not sure why it's rated so low, its definitely up there with the best spoofs

reviews.review_title: It was better then I expected
reviews.content: I have to say I wasn't expecting much going to see the movie. But I actually liked it better then I thought it would. Although I think the writers/producers who began with Scary Movies 1,2 &3 have pushed the limits with scary movie 4, date movie, epic movie and so on. There are some obvious sexual references and innuendos but those are what make the movie funny and gives it its PG-13 rating. The swearing is miminal. I have heard way worse. While I enjoy Drake bell, some of the spider-man references were even too strong and I wondered what about the other superhero movies or the movie I just paid 10 dollars to see! all in all 50%

reviews.review_title: Don't spend your $10 on this one..
reviews.content: I think I'm being generous by giving this movie a 3/10. There were only 3 elements that made anybody laugh: people getting physically harmed, perverted jokes, and curse words left and right. I have to say I wasn't expecting much from this movie and I felt robbed of the money I spent on this. I was so close to walking out on it but unfortunately, my group didn't want to leave. The plot was boring and pointless, the acting was quite drab. It scares me how my generation can see this movie and actually find it funny. Take my advice if you have a sophisticated sense of humor: do not see this movie. But if you're a 10 year old boy who laughs at stupid things..then go for it.

my mom always told me if they cant be funny with out sex joke and cursing than the are not funny at all. I've always found sex funny *being a teenager* but this was lame i went to go see it an was expecting good things. if you are a fan of epic movie and the scary movies than go see this and maybe it will be at your maturity level. i am very disappointed that the movie was as bad as it was. i would rather chew off my own toe nails than watch this again. it had some very funny parts but the whole thing was so crude and repulsive that i forgot all about that. your money is better spent going to see "horton hears a who" than this...
Got through maybe 5-10 minutes. Couldn't take anymore. Wasn't in the least bit funny and was very stupid. I've seen other parody movies, but this one proves they need to stop.

reviews.review_title: The movie is an OK movie and is almost like the spiderman movie.
reviews.content: At first i thought that the movie was stupid but then the movie turned out to be OK.All the jokes in the movie was good and funny but the movie had over jokes which were not needed.Like spider man movie, this guys parents dies and he then lives with his grandparents but unlike spider man movie where the grand dad dies, in this movie the grand mother dies.due To the sick parts and bad language in the movie,the movie is not meant for watching with your parents or with your young brother.like in spiderman movie, when the guy gets bitten and after sometimes when he gets bitten by a dragon fly,everything he touches gets stuck to his hands.Frankly speaking the movie was just like the copy of the spiderman movie except that there are more jokes in this movie compared to spider man movie.

reviews.review_title: I really liked this move, it made me laugh and the story is interesting.
reviews.content:
In my opinion, it's a very well made parody of many classic superhero titles. Of course you won't get the references if you never watched a Spiderman movie, an X-Men movie or a Batman movie, but if you at least know those franchises, then the references will make the movie a lot richer.
The jokes are funny, the acting is funny, the movie doesn't take itself seriously and it's light, things are supposed to be exaggerated and comical and it's great that way. It's a movie for you to relax and....just laugh and have some fun.

my first review so sorry if its not good. This movie got some laughs from me and I think was actually an alright storyline and plot. Considering most spoof/parody movies this one was good compared to some others I have seen that are just plain stupid and have no point. This movie I can only watch a few times and not very often like most spoofs they get annoying after a couple of watches. In this spoof you can actually tell what movies they are doing a spoof of and even though the scenes are stupid they aren't as stupid as most spoof movies that you can get annoyed at them. I would recommend this movie to people who like silly and spoof movies. I personally give this movie a 5 out of 10

This movie is very funny, when you like light humor. But be warned, there may be some scenes that you may dislike. I, myself, hated three scenes, where the humor really was to extreme for me to accept. But, well, Leslie Nielsen is really in super condition this time. Only to have seen his scenes makes the movie totally worth it! He is acting so great, I can't forget the laughs I had.The ideas, the creators had, how to set up a superhero parody is simply astonishing! The characters are very lovable and you will like them at once. If this movie wouldn't have the comedy scenes in it, I would have considered it the superhero movie of the year.But, again, be warned: This really isn't a movie everyone will like. The scenes vary enormeausly from very profane humor to brilliant masterpiece comedy. In these enormeasly profane scenes, I just couldn't figure out, if they did happen, because they switched producers, where high or what else was going on in the producers' brains - if someone knows, please tell me!

reviews.review_title: Not a movie for kids or teenagers
reviews.content: I went to see this movie with my boyfriend last night. I'm 20 years old and this movie was way too much for ME. I couldn't imagine taking a teenager, preteen, or (especially) a child to this movie. It was crude and offensive. I was totally misled by its PG-13 rating and the previews that I had seen for it. I had originally seen previews for it on Nickelodeon, and I thought that it looked pretty cute (maybe I just don't remember the preview correctly) . Plus, Drake Bell (the movie's main character) stars on a Nickelodeon television show that targets preteens and young teenagers. I really didn't think that the movie's content would be as risky as it was. I should have done more research about it before I went. However, I'm hoping that parents will read up on this movie before they take their kids to see it just because it has Drake Bell in it.Seriously, do NOT take your kids or teenagers to see this movie. The rating should have been R. There are tons of sexual references, drug references, and disturbing events throughout the movie. Examples: Drake Bell gets attacked by sexually charged animals, several scenes that involve men grabbing women's breasts, lots of profanity, Drake Bell uses a bong to smoke vanilla frosting (or something like that), people get stabbed, hit, and hurt in the movie, and an elderly lady and her dog get shredded. There are tons of other offensive and disgusting scenes throughout the movie. It was really demeaning to women in general. The movie is by the people that made the Scary Movie series, so that should tell you something right there. Please remember that seeing movies like this can give kids and teenagers all kinds of wrong ideas about sex, drugs, and violence. Most children and teenagers can't decipher between spoofs or comedy and reality.I do have a sense of humor. I also know that the humor that was in this film is typical of its genre. But I find the possibility of children and teenagers going to see this movie HORRIFYING.As for the overall quality of the movie, I didn't think it was that original or funny. It dragged in parts and some of the humor was just forced and painful. The acting wasn't TOO bad, considering how bad the script was. If you're an adult or older teen looking for a funny movie, skip this one or rent it.

Super Hero Movie brings to the table a parody of Spider Man with a few other superhero parodies involved.The thing about this movie is that you absolutely must start watching it with the notion that it is going to be silly and stupid. With that aside, you can actually enjoy this movie. It will not bring you to tears like Spiderman does, it will not make you get up and cheer like how the original Superman movies did and it will not put you in a world of wonder as Batman did for me. If you are like me and I suspect that many people are, this movie will simply give you a few laughs and help you to relax at the end of your long day.The parodied situations are classic and the actors did a good job of being silly and stupid in this movie. Leslie Neilson does a great job being his normal character and offers a few comical moments. A person that has a great and varied sense of humor will like this movie.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest spoof movies of all time!
reviews.content: With the launch of the DVD, I figured I ought to review this great spoof movie! I enjoyed this movie a lot more than the recent "Disaster Movie" and it's a sure recommend for anyone looking fora good laugh.The movie is basically a spoof of the Superhero genre as a whole and in particular of Spiderman! extremely funny for a fan of superhero movies! I was laughing throughout the movie, even on my second viewing! And I rarely find silly jokes funny, but this movie is a pure gem! I guess I'm giving it a few too many good points, but my only basis of comparison is with Disaster Movie, which really does not kick up much of a fight.In reality, I can't say much about the movie, but it will certainly attract those that are fans of the superhero genre and also people that are just generally out for a good laugh! So I'll certainly recommend this movie, but please don't expect anything too intellectual!

Sometimes before watching a movie, you make the compromise based on the title mainly that you shouldn't expect anything spectacular or innovative.Being prepared I am not going to watch a sample of amazing comedy I was still a bit disappointed by the movie overall. Watching it in ideal conditions for a movie of its kind still leaves you with a sense of incompleteness.Overall, mildly entertaining. It had potential to be more fun if was made pg-15 at least. Some scenes seemed to miss a climax point. I watched all of it, but I wouldn't mind if I hadn't seen.

This came out at the time of terrible spoof movies but it is actually kinda funny in moments. It has practically no plot but unlike others you can definitely find enjoyment by turning your brain off. I recommend it to younger viewers.

...and that's all to remember of it.At the very beginning were not so really bad (therefore 2 instead 1) but the last 4/5 are horrible. I didn't went in cinema and I didn't buy it, that was the good news; but I've spent 100 minutes to watch it with friends.Trying to be fresh and up-to-date is OK, but such kind of films are not contemporary any more at all, that's the problem.Sorry that I have to write 10 lines about this films, it doesn't worth so much attendance. However I've decided to do it... to preserve others to waste their time with the bored story.To be honest, there much more "serious" movies more boring that that.

I caught myself laughing out loud during the dumbest moments. The slapstick & meta humor is still funny, the whole thing is super over the top. There are some jokes that are cringe worthy, but the overall flow is worth it. Plus, you get Leslie Nielsen being his hilarious self.

reviews.review_title: In all honesty, it's not that bad!
reviews.content: I had seen the trailer for the movie and friends had recommended it to me, but I didn't expect anything beyond the infrequent chuckle. It looked like an average comedy, so I began watching it with no real expectations. I just thought it would at least be entertaining.But, to my surprise, it turned out to be both entertaining and hilarious. I laughed at least once a minute and I think it stands as a sort of modern "Airplane!".The movie, as you may have guessed, is a spoof of superhero flicks or all kinds, mostly recent, all put into the Spider-Man template.While the gags are sometimes painfully unfunny, they're at least well executed and hard to dislike. They all come so thick and fast you might miss them. But for the most part they are genuinely funny, always being delightfully silly and making the movie a guilty pleasure. You'll never see Stephen Hawking or Tom Cruise in the same way again.I am so glad they decided to drop Friedberg and Seltzer with this one. Just by looking at the title, you'll probably compare it to comedies like "Epic Movie" or "Disaster Movie", and thus overlook it. But I'm begging you not to with this one.I was honestly quite shocked at IMDb's rating of 4.4. 4.4? Seriously? If "Scary Movie" had a 6.0, this at least deserved a whole star above it.No much else to say, except I think you'll be pleasantly surprised. Give it a watch if you want to see the first good parody in a while.

reviews.review_title: Way too mature for a PG-13 movie
reviews.content: I happened to rent this movie with my sister in hopes of watching a great entertaining movie, that was humorous, however my expectations were let down. This movie was beyond disgusting and revolting for a PG-13 movie, this should have been rated R for the many mature references that went on in this movie. I wouldn't recommend allowing a 13 year old teen see this.Even if no one under the age of 17 is watching this movie, beware of a truly stupid movie, there's no humor in the movie, just a bunch of disgusting sexual references including a small touch of pedophilia, something that shouldn't even be joked about. I would like to know what happened to PG-13 movies, that were actually safe for actual a 13 year old? This is beyond a deplorable movie and should be re-rated.

reviews.review_title: If you don't like toilet humour, just don't even bother.
reviews.content: Whilst this film probably won't appeal to adults, it certainly will appeal to 12-13 year olds. (but this film is NOT for small kids). I myself was 12 when I first saw this film and I was laughing endlessly from start to finish. Obviously nowadays the sex jokes and toilet humour isn't so funny any more. This film is almost ALL sex and toilet humour. And despite the stigmas, some people just happen to like this kind of thing! If you happen to be one of those people, then GO WATCH THIS MOVIE NOW. If you don't like toilet humour, just don't even bother. Stay far away from this film.I disagree on this movie's IMDb rating. I think even though I've matured and don't find toilet humour that funny any more, it's still good for what it is. This isn't a fantastic movie, but it's a good one that will lift your spirits (unless you've just lost a parent).

reviews.review_title: An offensive, sick and worthless load of garbage...
reviews.content: Dreadful. Truly, truly dreadful. Do not watch this movie if you consider yourself to be a movie lover or someone with good taste. I consider myself to be both of these, and unfortunately I had to be put through this at school.Basically, I sometimes find sick humour funny. For example, I find Borat hilarious. But, like with most forms of humour, there is a point where sick humour stops being funny and becomes just plain sick. Superhero Movie crosses this line within the first ten minutes. Animal sex jokes are not funny. People getting killed isn't either. Like remember in Batman Begins, when Bruce's parents are murdered? That scene brings me dangerously close to tears sometimes. And making fun of it, in a blatantly obvious parody (they might as well shout, 'We're making fun of Batman Begins!') is really pathetic, I think.Which, of course, brings me to the fact that I do enjoy superhero films; The Dark Knight, Batman Begins, Iron Man, etc. And I can laugh at a few jokes about them (the spoofs on YouTube, for instance), but not when they're ridiculously sick and blindingly obvious. Even as a thirteen-year-old, I know that this film is in very, very poor taste. Do the makers of Superhero Movie think that the people watching it are stupid? Actually, don't answer that.

I like this movie. I won't shirk from it. For a start, the humor is good - and both in dialogue as well as through actions - it keeps its humor intact, while actually spotting out some rather witty interactions (the dinner scene for instance). Given that we had Kick Ass (2010) and the Spiderman movies (2002-2008) out around this time, and that the protagonist is likable in my opinion, with a clearly defined villain and a simplistic story overall, why would you rate it low? Let's be honest, it's better than Scary Movie 3 (2003), and it has much better entertainment value than Frozen (2013). And best part, it doesn't require you to think or be involved AT ALL - if nothing else, you are prompted to refer to the movies (which by the way, is a good quality of this movie - some of the movies it pokes at are good movies).In my opinion, give it a watch. I wasn't disappointed. And I've seen the epitomes of disappointment - Ark (2003) and Get Hard (2015).
After a long i can see a movie who makes me laugh but why the rating are too much low

reviews.review_title: Not Suitable for Younger Fans of Drake Bell/Sara Paxton!!!!!!
reviews.content: We took a group of 13 year old female fans of Drake Bell's (it's rated PG-13, right?), and they walked out before the end. They thought the movie was horrible and the language was too vulgar. Sure there were a few funny non-offensive parts, but as a whole the movie rated a big fat zero with these (former?) Drake fans. This movie will only appeal to teen/college-age boys, so be forewarned! Drake and Sara both have a younger fan base, so not sure why they both chose this route, unless trying to be "cool"? I'm afraid this type of "coolness" didn't go over with our movie-going group. It also was depressing to watch Marion Ross and Leslie Neilsen digging ditches at the end of their careers. Leslie Neilsen is incredibly funny, but not in this film. Badly written, IMHO.

This movie was clearly marketed to children--the Drake and Josh star, etc. However, if you're any kind of decent parent, you won't want your kids to watch it--even if they're 13.DO NOT let your kids watch this trash. Check the parent's advisory info and see tons and tons of sexual and language issues found in this movie. In fact, this movie is a catalog of what kids shouldn't see--1 per minute or so.Had to turn it off 10 minutes into it.This should have easily been rated R for language and sexual content. The ratings system is definitely too lax these days.

reviews.review_title: Often Funny But Falls Just Short of the Mark
reviews.content: I'm a huge fan of spoofs. That's spoofs, not reference movies, (Date Movie, Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans. I'm a fan of all the Scary Movies, Naked Guns, and Hot Shots. So how does this rank? Well here's the thing. It's NOTHING like the Friedberg/Seltzer movies, which is great by all standards. However, Mazin still throws us sh*t jokes, urine jokes, and bodily function humor in general. Particularly a fart joke that will make you groan if you're over 16. With all the negatives aside, this movie can be quite clever at times, and it has a coherent storyline. It uses Spiderman/2 for plot outline, and throws in some gags from other superhero movies as well.So is this a revival of the genre? Well, it has brought up the level from Friedberg/Seltzer, but it doesn't have enough originality and spunk to save the genre. Another thing I thought was great was how they had the decency to bring back the movie theater style poster. All in all, if you're just looking for crude tasteless fun, check it out, but don't go expecting anything too great.

I always recommend this movie to new people because it was so underrated and funny to me but i guess everyone has their own thing😊
This is the funniest parody movie i ever seen!!!

15 years later this is still a silly good time Writer-director Craig Mazin teams with David Zucker to make a superhero movie....but one that's actually poking fun at them A collection of colorful actors like Drake Bell, Sara Paxton, Christopher McDonald, Brent Spiner, Kevin Hart, the late Leslie Nielsen, Regina Hall, Pamela Anderson, Tracy Morgan, and Jeffrey Tambor Thank god this is one of the better parodies NOT involving Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer! Here the filmmakers are basically making fun of the first 'Spider-Man' having the main character named Rick Riker bitten by a dragonfly instead of a spider He develops super powers like strength, invulnerability, crawling to walls but he can't fly As expected he's in love with his next door neighbor Jill but doesn't have the courage to do anything Meanwhile the head CEO of Amalgamated Pharmaceuticals creates a way to stop death but he has to absorb other people's life energy to stay alive Hoping to make it permanent he plans to steal a rare mineral to absorb Empire City and Dragonfly is the only one who can stop him So many of these jokes and gags jab at 'X-Men', 'Fantastic Four' and 'Spider-Man' but also trying to maintain the heart of the story That's still notoriously difficult to do these days and humor isn't easy to balance Still this is one of the rare spoofs that manages to get some decent laughs It's not gonna work for everyone and one of the worst things in the movie involves the obligatory flatulence stuff, one scene in particular goes on for 5 minutes The pop culture references are expected too like Facebook and YouTube I definitely got the best bits from Nielsen and Hall Plus Drake Bell is a hoot to watch as a clumsy nerd becoming a hero next to Sara Paxton who's cute but still has a tremendous heart There's lots of instances where you can clearly see this was on a budget and some of the jokes haven't aged well but again this isn't high art we are looking for A decent enough comedy that'll kill an hour and a half making us appreciate real superhero movies

Ricky Riker (Drake Bell) is a typical teenager, except that his luck is worse then most. Basically, he's a loser. He's been in love with beautiful Jill (Sara Paxton) for years, but is sure she doesn't know he exists. Even his techie best friend, Trey (Kevin Hart), is willing to throw him over for another clique. But Rick's life changes dramatically when a genetically enhanced dragonfly bites him during a school field trip. In a flash, he becomes the Dragonfly. He can scale buildings, and has immense strength - though he's still a klutz. Rick isn't sure he has what it takes to be a superhero, but it's up to him to save the city from the villainous Hourglass (Christopher McDonald).

also stars Leslie Nielsen, Brent Spiner, Jeffrey Tambor, Ryan Hansen, Robert Hays, Nicole Sullivan, Marion Ross and Pamela Anderson.

directed by Craig Mazin.

I went in expecting nothing. To my surprise, it was not a worthless throwaway spoof that cannot tie gags together in a coherent manner. It is not remarkable by any means, but it is kind of fun. The spoofing is very mainly targeted at the Spiderman series. They borrow from other sources as well, but these parts feel a little forced; so perhaps it is for the best that they kept it simple. There is not an effective train full of gags that a great spoof requires but at least there are not painful draughts of laugher. Drake Bell knows what he is doing, he knows it is ridiculous and he has fun with it. His high energy help prevent this movie from tanking. Also he gets great support from Christopher McDonald, Kevin Hart, and Leslie Nielsen, the king of spoofs. I only wish these secondary cast members were utilized even more, because they help immensely. Unfortunately the movie loses its discipline and prematurely wraps things up in a very haphazard manner. This is not polished at and all and it could have been better in many ways but it is worth watching and it is still a good time.

I appreciate the opinions of the respected critics who have already reviewed this movie, but they massively misunderstood the movie (seemingly in every aspect). Yes the jokes are hugely overused and familiar even to the novices of the movie industry, but the whole idea of this movie (as was the scary movie series) is to make fun of the dull repetitive structure of superhero movies. This film despite using possibly too many fart jokes for one to bear, made me laugh from beginning to beyond the credits, and quite frankly was far funnier than a lot of movies that try to hard to be unique or clever in some regard. I am more than proud to say that this is a movie that I will return to in the near future, as my experience has been unmatched by any other movie that I have seen. Well... except maybe Scary Movie 3.

Movie parodies are a dying art.

I'm not talking about movie satires in general, no, that will always be around. I'm talking about actual movies that are spoofs. They just don't make movies like Spaceballs or Airplane anymore. Now we are stuck with "Movie movies", lazy, zeitgeisty, pop culture reference bloated "films" that are more focused on making the movie look funny than actually being funny. It's like watching a collection of manatee jokes from Family Guy for two hours; the only difference is that this is live action, barely. Granted Superhero Movie is not a cinematic atrocity like Epic Movie, but that doesn't mean it's any good.

This movie mainly parodies Spider-Man, with scenes with X-Men, Batman Begins, and so on. Unlike Epic Movie, this actually stays true to the title throughout. Only superhero movies are spoofed here. The number of movies being satirized is smaller than Epic Movie, but that just makes it more focused and more structured. For the majority of the gags, they actually feel like gags. Not good gags, but gags. In the aforementioned Epic Movie, the "jokes" feel more like references than jokes. 

Drake Bell of Drake & Josh fame stars in Epic Movie, and he is one of the two actors in this movie who actually aren't that bad. He plays a riff on the Tobey Maguire Peter Parker, and his comedic timing is often the only thing that works about the gags. He is throughout most of the movie the only straight faced actor on camera. Almost everybody else is winking at the camera and just being obnoxious. The one other decent performance is Leslie Nielsen, in one of his last ever movie roles. He plays the Uncle Ben/Alfred Pennyworth character. He tries the best he can to make the jokes enjoyable, and he occasionally succeeds,  but the script sucks so hard that not even Leslie "Don't Call Me Shirley" Nielsen can't be enjoyable.

So in the end, Superhero Movie isn't as awful as the Seltzerburg films, mainly due to decent performances from Bell and Nielsen, but even they don't make this worth watching. Somebody out there has to make another good spoof movie, the world needs it.
An endless string of well timed but old, tired gags. Even though some are really funny, many aren't, and either way you need more than that for a good movie.

The story is about Rick Riker played by Drake Bell whose dream girl is the girl next door Jill Johnson played by Sara Paxton. When he gets bitten by a genetically-engineered dragonfly, he turned into the superhero known as Dragonfly, possessing superpowers of a dragonfly except for flying. This is obviously a huge parody of Spider-Man. He witnesses a flashback in one scene where his parents are killed like in Batman Begins, giving the reason why he lives with his aunt and uncle played y Marion Ross and the late Leslie Nielsen. In order to control his powers, Xavier played by Tracy Morgan introduces him to his gifted school of superheroes like in X-Men where he meets Wolverine, Storm and Invisible Girl (parody of Invisible Woman from Fantastic Four) played by Pamela Anderson. When Dragonfly's nemesis, Lou Landers played by Christopher McDonald becomes the life-sucking Hourglass, it is up to Dragonfly to save Jill before Hourglass takes over the world. The film's main parody is Spider-Man. Other parodies that can be caught are Batman Begins, X-Men and Fantastic Four. I thought this was a good movie, it had a good story, made me laugh and did not center around too many movies to be called a parody. This is a good parody movie. Forget the Jason Friedberg and Aaron Steltzer shit and watch this because Superhero Movie gets a 9.5/10.

Superhero Movie is not a completely satisfying comedy film. It works to an extent as an accurate Spider-Man parody. It has serviceable comedy performances from Drake Bell, Christopher McDonald and Leslie Nielsen and has an amusing minor roleSuperhero Movie is not a completely satisfying comedy film. It works to an extent as an accurate Spider-Man parody. It has serviceable comedy performances from Drake Bell, Christopher McDonald and Leslie Nielsen and has an amusing minor role for Jeffrey Tambor, and the whole cast make the very best they can of writer/director Craig Mazin's mostly uninspiring script. The film is far weaker when the story veers off on tangents and tries to spoof films other than Sam Raimi's Spider-Man films in obvious and embarrassingly unfunny ways, particularly criminal is the offensively bad X-Men parody featuring Tracy Morgan. Since it does make you laugh now and again (mostly from ZAZ-influenced jokes that likely resulted from David Zucker serving as one of the film's producers), Superhero Movie is definitely on the better side of bad films, and is far superior to the woeful Epic Movie and Disaster Movie. It's just a shame that it's not more consistently funny, as there is little left to hide Craig Mazin's pretty sloppy filmmaking technique when you're not laughing. At the end of the day, being "the best of the Scary Movie spin-offs" isn't really much of an accolade.

rt_summary: After a bite from a genetically altered insect gives him superhuman abilities, teenage loser Rick Riker (Drake Bell) decides to use his powers for good. Donning an uncomfortably tight costume, Rick becomes a mysterious crime fighter known as "The Dragonfly." But standing in the way of truth, justice and the American Way is an evil villain known as "The Hourglass," who plans to become immortal by sucking the life force out of anyone who gets in his way.
meta_summary: How many superheroes does it take to save the world? The creators of The Naked Gun and Scary Movie answer this question in hysterical David Zucker fashion with the uproarious comedy Superhero Movie. Meet Rick Riker. He's young, he's cool, and he's got superpowers. Now, if he only knew how to use them... But the world is in danger, and noHow many superheroes does it take to save the world? The creators of The Naked Gun and Scary Movie answer this question in hysterical David Zucker fashion with the uproarious comedy Superhero Movie. Meet Rick Riker. He's young, he's cool, and he's got superpowers. Now, if he only knew how to use them... But the world is in danger, and no one is safe when Zucker and the gang--headed by the hilarious cast of Drake Bell, Leslie Nielsen, Tracy Morgan, Pamela Anderson, Regina Hall, and many others--take aim at some of the biggest blockbusters of our time, including Spider-Man, Batman, X-Men, and Fantastic Four, to name a few. On March 28, learning to fly, spinning a web, and busting a gut has never been this much fun. (The Weinstein Company)… Expand
